0.title: Pune's BORI to hold online lectures on Maratha history from Mar 21
0.article_body: Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune will be organising an online lecture series on Maratha history from March 21 to April 2. The twelve-part series will cover topics, including India's pre-Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj political background, establishment of Swarajya, expansion of the Maratha empire, among others. It'll be jointly organised with the Bharat Itihas Sanshodhak Mandal.

1.title: Meta-worse for democracy: Rahul on 'Facebook charging BJP less' claim
1.article_body: Former Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday tweeted "Meta-worse for democracy". Gandhi also shared reports by Al Jazeera and The Reporters' Collective, which claimed that Facebook had offered BJP cheaper deals for election advertisements than other parties. Congress president Sonia Gandhi asked the government to put an end to "Facebook's interference" in India's electoral politics.

2.title: PM congratulates Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, says 'will work together'
2.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated AAP leader Bhagwant Mann on taking oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab. PM Modi said, "Will work together for the growth of Punjab and welfare of the state's people." Mann took oath at Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh.

3.title: Was being harsh: Brian Cox on calling Johnny Depp 'overrated' actor
3.article_body: Actor Brian Cox said he regrets calling Johnny Depp an "overrated" actor. "I...thought I was being a bit harsh," he said. Brian added, "It's like, you go for the easy joke...I went for the easy joke. That was what happened." This comes after Brian stated he declined 'Pirates of the Caribbean' and called Depp overblown, overrated in his memoir.

4.title: 66 FDI proposals from neighbouring countries approved since Apr 2020: Govt
4.article_body: India has received 347 foreign direct investment (FDI) proposals from neighbouring countries since April 2020, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Som Parkash said. The total value of the proposals is about ₹75,951 crore. The highest number of approved proposals, at eight, were from the electronics sector, followed by the automobile and chemicals sectors at seven and five respectively.

5.title: IFS officer shares rainbow eucalyptus pics, says it's 'the world's most colourful tree'
5.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda has shared pictures of rainbow eucalyptus and tweeted, "The rainbow eucalyptus is the only eucalyptus tree indigenous to the northern hemisphere and happens to be the most colourful tree in the world." He added that the rainbow effect is created as the bark peels off throughout each season and reveals "fresh, bright coloured bark below".

6.title: Give us time: SC on listing plea challenging HC's hijab order
6.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will consider listing an appeal challenging the Karnataka High Court's order upholding the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions. When senior advocate Sanjay Hegde sought urgent listing, SC said, "Give us time. We will see." The bench clarified it won't hear the matter on Monday when SC reopens after the Holi vacation.

7.title: 20 lakh kids in 12-14 age group eligible for COVID vaccination in K'taka
7.article_body: As COVID-19 vaccination for children aged between 12-14 years started in India, Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar flagged off the COVID-19 vaccination drive for the children in this age group at Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College in Bengaluru today. He said that about 20 lakh children in this age group are eligible for the vaccination in the state.

8.title: 7 consume liquor, assault forest official in Gurugram; 5 arrested
8.article_body: Police on Monday arrested five college students from Gurugram's Sultanpur National Park for allegedly assaulting a forest inspector of the state forest department after he asked them not to consume liquor. According to the police, seven suspects had arrived, out of which five were arrested, one escaped and another was admitted to the hospital for fracturing his leg while escaping.

9.title: I-T Dept recovers ₹20 crore cash in raids on Omaxe's offices: Reports
9.article_body: The Income Tax Department has recovered ₹20 crore in cash after conducting raids on various offices of realty firm Omaxe Limited, ANI reported. The department has also seized "accounts and sales documents which show more than ₹200 crore unaccounted transactions of the company". The raids, which started on Monday, are still underway at 38 out of 45 premises.

10.title: We don’t take such singles, it’s basic cricket: Veda on Deepti's run-out
10.article_body: Discussing India all-rounder Deepti Sharma's run-out in the 2022 Women's World Cup match against England, Veda Krishnamurthy said, "Even in domestic cricket, we don't take singles like that." "We generally say that this is basic cricket," added Veda. Deepti was dismissed for 0 off 10 deliveries. India were reduced to 28/3 after her dismissal.

11.title: B'luru's LILA Games raises $10 mn, PUBG-maker KRAFTON invests too
11.article_body: Bengaluru-based mobile game development studio LILA Games has raised $10 million in a Series A funding led by Rainfall Ventures. The round also saw participation from BITKRAFT Ventures, Galaxy Interactive, Sequoia Capital, and PUBG-maker KRAFTON. Founded by Joseph Kim, Paul Leydon, and Avinash Pandey, the gaming startup secured $2.8 million in its seed round in November 2020.

12.title: Markaz Nizamuddin mosque to reopen for Shab-e-Barat: Delhi Police
12.article_body: Delhi Police have permitted the reopening of the Markaz Nizamuddin mosque for prayers on the occasion of Shab-e-Barat, nearly two years after it was locked and public entry was prohibited. However, only less than 100 people will be allowed on each storey, as per the guidelines of the Delhi Disaster Management Authority. Entry will be allowed for fully vaccinated people.

13.title: 2 lakh trees illegally chopped down in Maha in 4 years: CM Uddhav Thackeray
13.article_body: Over two lakh trees were illegally cut down in Maharashtra in the last four years, said Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray who is also in charge of the state's forest department. "At least 48,893 criminal cases have been filed during this period, of which 1,435 are registered as serious offences," he said while informing the state legislative council on Wednesday.

14.title: CBI chargesheets ex-national auditor SK Sharma in ₹3,600cr AgustaWestland scam
14.article_body: CBI has filed a supplementary chargesheet in the ₹3,600-crore AgustaWestland scam against former national auditor Shashi Kant Sharma and four Indian Air Force personnel, officials said. The alleged scam is related to the purchase of 12 VVIP helicopters from AgustaWestland. Sharma was the Defence Secretary between 2011 and 2013 before being appointed the Comptroller and Auditor General.

15.title: Global COVID-19 cases rise for first time since January: WHO
15.article_body: The World Health Organisation (WHO) said global COVID-19 infections rose by 8% in the last week, reversing a decline in cases that first began in January this year. There were more than 11 million new COVID-19 infections last week and over 43,000 coronavirus-related deaths, WHO added. The number of COVID-19 deaths worldwide has been declining for the past three weeks.

16.title: Razorpay acquires Pune's IZealiant, marks its fifth acquisition
16.article_body: Fintech unicorn Razorpay has acquired Pune-based digital payments startup IZealiant Technologies for an undisclosed sum. As a part of the acquisition, Razorpay will absorb the entire team of IZealiant Technologies. This is Razorpay's fifth acquisition since its inception in 2014. Last month, it had acquired Malaysian fintech firm Curlec, marking its first international acquisition.

17.title: 2 missing mobile phones worth ₹45,000 traced by Hyd crime team
17.article_body: Station House Officer (SHO) of Hyderabad's Abid Road police station B Prasadha Rao informed that two missing mobile phones worth ₹45,000 were traced by the crime team and were handed over to the owners. In a similar incident, Rao tweeted on March 12, informing that three missing mobile phones worth ₹66,000 were traced and handed over to the complainants.

18.title: Govt planning to develop Indian road network as that of US by 2024: Gadkari
18.article_body: The government is planning to develop India's road network equivalent to that of the US by the end of 2024, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari informed Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. He further said that there is a need to create awareness about road safety as the number of road accidents is higher than number of people killed in war.

19.title: One child becoming a refugee every second in Ukraine due to war: UN
19.article_body: The United Nations on Wednesday said more than 1.5 million children have now fled Ukraine since the Russian invasion began on February 24. According to the latest "shocking" figures, "Every single minute, 55 children have fled their country. That is, a Ukrainian child has become a refugee almost every single second," UN children's agency (UNICEF) spokesperson James Elder said.

20.title: Latest rankings for Test bowlers released, Jasprit Bumrah jumps six spots
20.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test bowlers, with India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah jumping six spots to be ranked fourth. Ravichandran Ashwin is the top-ranked Indian bowler at the second position, while the rankings are led by Australia captain Pat Cummins. Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi dropped one place to be ranked fifth.

21.title: Netherlands will continue to supply weapons to Ukraine: Minister
21.article_body: Netherlands and other NATO countries will continue supplying weapons to Ukraine, even if those deliveries may become targets of Russian attacks, Dutch Defence Minister Kajsa Ollongren has said. "Ukraine has...right to defend itself, we'll continue to support it," she added. Her remarks come days after Russia attacked a Ukrainian military base near Poland's border, which is a member of NATO.

22.title: Father rapes 2 minor daughters for 2 yrs near Mumbai; arrested
22.article_body: Police arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly raping his two daughters, aged 12 and seven for two years in Boisar near Mumbai. The accused has been sexually assaulting his daughters on knifepoint ever since his wife died in March 2020. The girls shared their ordeal with activists of a tribal organisation, who helped them file a complaint against their father.

23.title: Shivangi Joshi recalls meeting Prabhas, says 'I'm a big fan of Baahubali'
23.article_body: Actress Shivangi Joshi, who played the role of Naira in the show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', recalls meeting actor Prabhas in 2019 and said she's a big-time 'Baahubali' fan. Speaking about Prabhas, Shivangi said he's very sweet. "It was really nice meeting him. I initially thought, 'What will he say', but he was very nice and humble," she added.

24.title: May not be possible for any director to think of story like RRR: Jr NTR
24.article_body: Telugu actor Jr NTR, when asked if he would have accepted 'RRR' with another director, said that it might not be possible for any director to think of a story like 'RRR'. "I can say that multi-starrer movies and crossover movies will continuously come from now onwards," he added. 'RRR', directed by SS Rajamouli, also features actor Ram Charan.

25.title: Wish I had kept the nose of my ancestors: Bella on getting nose job at 14
25.article_body: Model Bella Hadid said she regrets getting a nose operation done at the age of 14. "I wish I had kept the nose of my ancestors." Speaking about the comparisons made between her and sister-model Gigi Hadid, Bella said she always used to believe that she was the "uglier" sister because she wasn't as "cool" and "outgoing" as Gigi.

26.title: Russian journalist interrogated for 14 hrs after protesting war on state TV
26.article_body: The journalist, who interrupted a live state TV news bulletin to protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine, said she was interrogated for over 14 hours. "I wasn't allowed to get in touch with my family, friends. I was denied access to a lawyer," Marina Ovsyannikova said. Ovsyannikova had run into the news studio holding a sign saying, "No war".

27.title: Number of casual leaves for police officials increased from 12 to 20 in Maha
27.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Tuesday said the number of casual leaves (CLs) for police officials in the state has been increased from 12 to 20 per year. Police officials will also not be assigned night duty a day before their weekly off. The decision aims to offer comfort to them as their duty hours are long and hectic, government said.

28.title: Apple's biggest office evacuated after envelope with white powder found in US
28.article_body: Apple Park, the company's biggest campus in Cupertino, US, was partially evacuated on Tuesday after an envelope containing a white powder substance was discovered. The fire department's incident report showed there was a fire alarm and hazmat response at Apple's headquarters. Authorities concluded that there was no presence of hazardous materials and employees were allowed back inside.

29.title: Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth now 4 times higher than Paytm CEO's
29.article_body: India's richest self-made woman and Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar's net worth is now nearly four times higher than that of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, as per Forbes data. Sharma's fortune briefly fell below $1 billion on Wednesday, but currently stands at $1.1 billion. Meanwhile, Nayar's net worth stands at $4.9 billion. Both their companies went public in 2021.

30.title: Oscar-winning British filmmaker Steve McQueen receives knighthood
30.article_body: British filmmaker Steve McQueen received his knighthood at Windsor Castle on Tuesday. Princess Anne bestowed the knighthood upon McQueen instead of Queen Elizabeth II. McQueen's 2013 film '12 Years a Slave' is among his notable works and had won him an Oscar, BAFTA and a Golden Globe. In the UK, McQueen will be known as Sir Steve McQueen.

31.title: AAP was born because of their deceit during Anna Hazare’s agitation: Anil Vij
31.article_body: The birth of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) took place because of the "deceit" they did during social activist Anna Hazare's agitation in Delhi, Haryana minister Anil Vij said on Wednesday. "People of Punjab have selected them, let's see if they are able to fulfil their promises in the coming years or they fail to do so," Vij added.

32.title: History-sheeter killed in encounter in Tirunelveli: Tamil Nadu Police
32.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police said they killed a history-sheeter, "Neeravi" Murugan, in an encounter. Murugan had about 60 cases, including murder, registered against him in Thoothukudi and Madurai, among other districts. A police officer opened fire on Murugan in self-defence when he attacked the police officials with sickles near Kalakadu, Tirunelveli Superintendent of Police, P Saravanan, said.

33.title: B'luru Police chief to hold Q&A session on FB to address people's issues
33.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has said that he'll hold a live question and answer session on Facebook with the city's residents on Saturday (March 19). He has asked people to share their grievances, ideas and suggestions with him using the hashtag #AskCPBlr on Bengaluru City Police's Facebook page. The session will be held from 11 am to 12 pm.

34.title: UN seeks nearly $4.3 billion aid to fight hunger in Yemen
34.article_body: The United Nations is seeking to raise nearly $4.3 billion to fight hunger in war-torn Yemen. According to the UN, over 1.7 crore people in the country need food assistance and this number could rise to 1.9 crore in the second half of 2022. It estimated that around 73 lakh people could face emergency levels of hunger by December.

35.title: Half-day leave for Assam govt employees to watch 'The Kashmir Files'
35.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said state government employees will get half-day leave to watch 'The Kashmir Files'. "They'll have to only inform their superior officers and submit the tickets the next day," he tweeted. Earlier, Sarma watched the movie with his cabinet and said he was moved by the portrayal of the plight of Kashmiri Pandits.

36.title: Intimate evening with friends: Anupam Mittal on pic with R Madhavan, Chetan Bhagat
36.article_body: Shark Tank India's judge Anupam Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture showing him hanging out with actor R Madhavan and author Chetan Bhagat. "An intimate evening with a few friends over the weekend made me feel that things are finally returning back to 'normal' after a long 2 years," Mittal wrote. "Hope I am right," he added.

37.title: 2022 will be among the 10 hottest years on record: Scientists
37.article_body: As per the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, 2022 had a baking-hot start and scientists are certain that this year is going to be among the top 10 hottest years on record. As per the global surface temperature recorded in January and February, 2022 was the sixth-hottest year. Moreover, there's 2.8% chance for 2022 to be the hottest year ever.

38.title: C'garh CM invites all MLAs to watch 'The Kashmir Files' in Raipur cinema hall
38.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has invited all MLAs in the state, including the opposition members, to watch 'The Kashmir Files' movie in a cinema hall in Raipur on Wednesday. "Tonight at 8 o'clock, all of the MLAs and invited citizens will watch the film together in a cinema hall in the capital," said Baghel in a tweet.

39.title: Shot few crucial scenes of RRR in Ukraine; in touch with crew there: Rajamouli
39.article_body: RRR director SS Rajamouli spoke about shooting a portion of his movie in Ukraine. He said, "We had gone there to shoot some crucial scenes. When we were shooting, I had no idea about the issues that have now escalated into a war." Rajamouli added that he's in touch with his crew there and has also enquired about their well-being.

40.title: Need assurance Medvedev doesn't support Putin: UK sports minister on Wimbledon
40.article_body: Talking about world number one men's tennis player, Russia's Daniil Medvedev featuring in this year's Wimbledon, UK Sports Minister Nigel Huddleston said, "We need...assurance [on him not being]...[a] supporter of Vladimir Putin." "People [won't] accept individuals...flying the Russian flag," added Huddleston. Medvedev will lose his number one ranking to Novak Djokovic on Monday (March 21).

41.title: Dhoni could give opportunity to younger guys: Jaffer on replacement for Chahar
41.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said CSK captain MS Dhoni could give opportunity to a younger pacer as a replacement for injured Deepak Chahar in the first few games of IPL 2022. "Dhoni could give confidence to uncapped guys...whether it's Tushar Deshpande, Simarjeet Singh or Mukesh Choudhary," stated Jaffer. Chahar got injured during the third T20I against West Indies.

42.title: 77 cr people covered under 'One Nation One Ration Card' scheme: Centre
42.article_body: Union Consumer Affairs Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday informed the Lok Sabha that as many as 77 crore people in the country have been covered under the 'One Nation One Ration Card' scheme. "The scheme is now available in 35 states and union territories," the minister said. The scheme allows nationwide portability of the ration card beneficiaries, he added.

43.title: Assam Police seize drugs worth ₹130 crore, 2 arrested
43.article_body: Assam Police arrested two youths after recovering drugs worth ₹130 crore from a truck on Wednesday. The accused were carrying drugs from Manipur to Assam when Assam Police's Crime Branch caught them at a toll gate. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma informed in a tweet, "4.6 lakh Yaba tablets, 12 kg Methamphetamine and 1.5 kg Heroin have been seized."

44.title: Vivek Agnihotri shares pic of threatening letter issued to Kashmiri Hindu family in 1990
44.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri has shared a picture of a threatening letter issued to a Kashmiri Hindu family in 1990. "Thank you @PMOIndia @narendramodi ji for reminding everyone about India's greatest value - The Truth. This is the TRUTH of Kashmir. If someone disputes this, I can present thousands of original documents like this," Agnihotri tweeted.

45.title: Anti-Hindu phobias also emerging: India on UN's 'Int'l Day to Combat Islamophobia'
45.article_body: As UNGA adopted resolution to proclaim March 15 as 'International Day to Combat Islamophobia', India expressed concern at the elevation of the phobia against one religion to such a level while excluding others. "Religiophobias have...affected the followers of non-Abrahamic religions as well. This have contributed to the emergence of...anti-Hindu, anti-Buddhist and anti-Sikh phobias," India said.

46.title: Practiced having gag in my mouth, consulted trauma expert: Amaara on 'Rudra..'
46.article_body: Amaara Sangam said that she consulted trauma expert to prepare for her role in 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness'. "I studied trauma responses and the physicality of it. I had to scream and project with gag in my mouth so I practiced having it in my mouth. In the process of preparation, I learned a lot about trauma," she added.

47.title: UP govt to invoke NSA against those helping students cheat in board exams
47.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has directed officials to invoke the National Security Act against those found helping students to cheat in Classes 10th and 12th state board examinations. Officials said a control room has been set up in Lucknow to monitor the examination centres. Over 51 lakh students will reportedly appear in the board examinations, which will start from March 24.

48.title: Looking forward to playing with Ashwin: RR's 20-yr-old Riyan Parag
48.article_body: RR all-rounder Riyan Parag, who was bought back by the franchise for ₹3.8 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's looking forward to playing alongside off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin in the upcoming IPL season. "I think I can pick his brains on the varieties and all the mysteries," Riyan stated. RR bought Ashwin for ₹5 crore in the auction.

49.title: Rahul, I share a great bond despite competing for the same spot: Mayank
49.article_body: Opener Mayank Agarwal said he shares a "great" bond with KL Rahul who is a fellow opener, despite "probably" competing for the same spot. Mayank added that Virat Kohli asked him to lift the trophy after India won their first-ever Test series in Australia in 2018-19. The opener made his Test debut in that historic 2018-19 series.

50.title: Bio-bubble should be done away with, becoming a laughing stock: Arun Lal
50.article_body: Sharing his opinion on bio-bubbles, ex-India cricketer Arun Lal said, "The bio-bubble should be done away with...It's becoming a laughing stock now. Children are going to school physically while we're trapped inside bio-bubbles." "It makes no sense," added the Bengal Ranji coach. "Yes, it was necessary at one stage," stated the former India cricketer.

51.title: Ruckus at Noida theatre after 'The Kashmir Files' paused briefly
51.article_body: The screening of 'The Kashmir Files' at a multiplex in Noida was paused briefly, following which people protested and a police team also reached the spot to pacify them. Police said there was a glitch in the central air conditioning system due to which the movie was paused. However, it was fixed immediately and the film show resumed soon.

52.title: Marriage with Dany not working out was the best thing in many ways: Dwayne
52.article_body: Wrestler-turned-actor Dwayne Johnson said his marriage with ex-wife Dany Garcia not working out was the "best thing" in so many ways. "It allowed her to meet the love of her life and me to meet the love of my life," added Dwayne. "The stuff you thought was important that you should sweat maybe...15 years ago [is] so meaningless," he stated.

53.title: EU plans to buy polio, COVID vaccines for Ukraine refugees: Official
53.article_body: European Union (EU) plans to procure and distribute vaccines of measles, polio, tuberculosis and COVID-19 among refugees from Ukraine, EU Health Commissioner Stella Kyriakides said on Tuesday. "Vaccination coverage in Ukraine was very low for several...preventable diseases, especially for children," Kyriakides added. About 35% Ukrainians are fully vaccinated against COVID-19, according to WHO.

54.title: Repair roads in 15 days: HC to BBMP after death due to pothole in B'luru
54.article_body: Karnataka High Court has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to conduct a three-day survey of potholes in Central Business District of Bangalore (CBD) and repair them within 15 days of the recent pothole accident. On Sunday night, a 27-year-old techie died by falling into a pothole. Demanding immediate action, HC said it feels "guilty and sorry" about the accident.

55.title: 2 cheat 100 people of ₹10 cr by promising govt jobs in Hyd; arrested
55.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly cheating over 100 people of about ₹10 crore by promising them jobs in the Food Corporation of India and Railways in Secunderabad. Rachakonda Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat said the prime accused was into liaison work and railway contracts in Delhi. He had allegedly cheated several people in various states, including Delhi and Telangana.

56.title: Kapil hits gym at 4 am, fan says 'After effects of shooting with Akshay'
56.article_body: Kapil Sharma took to Instagram to share a video of himself working out, with the caption reading, "When you have a 6 am shift, check in to the gym by 4 am." Reacting to the post, an Instagram user commented, "It's just after [effects] of shooting with Akshay Kumar." Akshay promoted his film 'Bachchhan Paandey' on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'.

57.title: Bihar Class 12th Board results out, 80.15% students clear exams
57.article_body: The results of Class 12 exams for the Bihar School Examination Board were declared on Wednesday and 80.15% of students cleared the exams. The exams for science, commerce and arts streams were conducted between February 1 and February 14. It has been announced that toppers of each stream will get ₹1 lakh cash, a laptop and Kindle eBook reader.

58.title: Considered wearing prosthetics to play dad's part: Ranbir on Sharmaji Namkeen
58.article_body: In a video message ahead of the film's trailer release, actor Ranbir Kapoor talks about his father Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen' and recalls how after the latter's death, they considered all options available to finish the film. He said, "We thought of trying VFX or I could wear prosthetics...But nothing was working out...And that's when...Paresh Rawal stepped in."

59.title: IPL came 2-3 years late in careers of icon players: Saba Karim
59.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim has said Sachin Tendulkar, VVS Laxman, Sourav Ganguly and Rahul Dravid would've benefitted if the IPL had started earlier. "IPL came 2-3 years late in the careers of icon players...they tried...[but] it was the last leg of their careers, it took time to adjust to T20s," he added. Tendulkar played 78 IPL games, scoring 2334 runs.

60.title: My wife is the genius behind this: RR's Hetmyer on sporting pink hair
60.article_body: Answering a question from a fan about him sporting pink hair after joining Rajasthan Royals, West Indies batsman Shimron Hetmyer said, "My wife is the...genius behind the whole thing." Hetmyer named SRH skipper Kane Williamson as his all-time favourite cricketer. "I should be able to score above 20 runs in nets against Yuzvendra Chahal," added Hetmyer.

61.title: Man sentenced to death for raping, killing 5-yr-old niece 8 years ago in UP
61.article_body: Special judge of POCSO court has awarded a man, Mohd Asif Khan, death sentence for raping and killing his five-year-old niece eight years ago. FIR in case said that the girl had gone missing. From evidence of witnesses, court found girl was last seen having ice-cream with Khan. The matter has been referred to High Court for confirmation of penalty.

62.title: COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia: ADB
62.article_body: Lockdowns imposed due to the COVID-19 pandemic caused 93 lakh job losses in Southeast Asia, Asian Development Bank (ADB) said in a report. The job losses pushed 47 lakh people to extreme poverty last year as inequality widened and movement restrictions hit retail and informal sectors the hardest. "The pandemic's impact on poverty and unemployment will likely persist," ADB said.

63.title: Latest rankings for Test batters out, Virat Kohli slips 4 spots to 9th
63.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for Test batters, with Virat Kohli slipping four spots to be ranked ninth. Further, Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne jumped three spots to be ranked fifth. India captain Rohit Sharma is the highest ranked Indian in the rankings at sixth position. Rishabh Pant is ranked tenth.

64.title: US startup whose robots serve food in restaurants raises $81 mn
64.article_body: US-based Bear Robotics, whose robots are used in several restaurants to serve customers, has raised $81 million in a Series B funding round. The funding saw participation from Cleveland Avenue, a VC firm founded by a former McDonald's chief executive. Bear Robotics claims its Servi robots have delivered 28 million meals so far.

65.title: SC to hear Amazon's plea for protection of Future Retail's assets on Mar 23
65.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear Amazon's application seeking relief against the alienation of Future Retail's assets on March 23. Amazon filed the plea after Reliance Industries began taking control of Future Retail's stores across India. The court proposed that Amazon can press for relief during proceedings before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre-governed tribunal.

66.title: Parked Delhi Capitals team bus attacked in Mumbai, 5 arrested
66.article_body: A parked Delhi Capitals team bus was attacked by miscreants in Mumbai on Tuesday. The Colaba Police have arrested five people following the incident, including Maharashtra Navnirman Sena's transport wing vice president Prashant Gandhi. The miscreants allegedly attacked the bus to protest against authorities for giving contract for IPL buses to a company based out of Delhi.

67.title: Who is Rosa Bonheur, the painter honoured by today's Google Doodle?
67.article_body: Google Doodle on Wednesday marked the 200th birth anniversary of Rosa Bonheur, the French painter whose career inspired a future generation of women in arts. Her reputation as an animal painter and sculptor grew in the 1840s, with her works exhibited at the prestigious Paris Salon from 1841-1853. In 1853, she garnered international acclaim with her painting 'The Horse Fair'.

68.title: Chinese stocks jump the most since 2008 after $1.5 tn wiped out in two days
68.article_body: Stocks across Hong Kong and China witnessed a massive rally after China's state council vowed to keep its stock market stable following a $1.5-trillion wipeout over the past two sessions. The Hang Seng China Enterprises Index jumped 13% on Wednesday, its biggest gain since the global financial crisis of 2008. Chinese technology firms including Alibaba and Tencent gained over 23%.

69.title: Pics show 214-million-year-old geological structure on Earth formed by meteorite
69.article_body: Astronaut Kayla Barron, who's currently aboard ISS, shared photos of a 214-million-year old geological structure on Earth. "The Manicouagan Reservoir and René-Levasseur Island always catch my eye during passes over Quebec," she wrote. "This...geological structure was formed...by a meteorite that scientists estimate was about 5 km in diameter and struck the earth at...17 km/s," Barron added.

70.title: Woman entrepreneur dies by suicide in balcony after cancer diagnosis in Karnataka
70.article_body: Female entrepreneur Suma Sathish, who was reportedly the owner of a textile company, allegedly died by suicide in the balcony of her home in Karnataka's Mangaluru in the early hours of Tuesday. Police said she allegedly took the step after being diagnosed with cancer. A case has been registered at Barke Police station.

71.title: Sensex jumps 1,040 points to end at 56,817; Nifty above 16,900
71.article_body: The Indian benchmark indices recouped the previous day's losses to end in the green on Wednesday amid positive global cues. The Sensex jumped nearly 1,040 points to close at 56,817, while the broader Nifty 50 also surged 312 points to end at 16,975. Ultratech Cement and Axis Bank were among top Sensex gainers, while Paytm ended 7% higher.

72.title: UP CM Yogi visits booths as COVID vaccination of 12-14 age group starts
72.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday visited a vaccination booth in Lucknow as COVID-19 vaccination of children in the 12-14 age group started in the country. CM Yogi said that over 84 lakh children will be given a "protective shield" under this vaccination drive. He added, "We need to be cautious as experts are predicting fourth wave of COVID-19."

73.title: Over 8,000 kids aged under 5 died in Maha in Feb-Aug 2021: Govt
73.article_body: Maharashtra Women and Child Development Minister Yashomati Thakur said over 8,000 children aged under five died in February-August 2021 during the COVID-19 pandemic. While emphasising that the state didn't neglect pregnant women, lactating mothers, malnourished and ailing children, Thakur said industrial and economically strong districts reported more deaths. Nagpur reported most deaths at 923.

74.title: Pune civic body announces drive against illegal encroachments
74.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced a drive against illegal encroachments across the city. PMC will remove illegal structures blocking the city roads but promises rehabilitation for authorised hawkers to other designated spots, Deputy PMC Commissioner Madhav Jagtap said. Action against those putting up illegal flex banners and flags will be taken, Jagtap added.

75.title: Man kills girlfriend's father for refusing his marriage proposal in Thane
75.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested by Thane Police on March 13 for allegedly murdering the father of his girlfriend for denying his marriage request. After the victim, Kamaljit Sande, denied the proposal, the accused, Pappukumar Shah, assured him he would respect his wish. However, on March 4, Shah took Sande out for a party and slit his throat.

76.title: Man accused of gangraping 16-yr-old girl & filming the act shot dead in Assam encounter
76.article_body: The prime accused in the case involving gangraping and filming a 16-year-old girl in Assam was shot dead in a police encounter when he allegedly tried to escape from custody after attacking a police team. Guwahati Medical College Hospital superintendent Abhijit Sarma said the accused, Biki Ali, sustained four injury marks, one in the chest and three in the back.

77.title: Joe Biden mistakenly calls Kamala Harris 'First Lady of the US'
77.article_body: US President Joe Biden mistakenly called Vice President Kamala Harris the "First Lady of the US" at an event. Biden made the gaffe when he was explaining that Harris would not attend the event because her husband, Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff, had contracted COVID-19. "I'm Joe Biden. I'm Jill Biden's husband and proud of it," Biden later joked.

78.title: Didn't want to do Saazish; hoped Saira would say no but she agreed: Dharmendra
78.article_body: Dharmendra shared a song from his and Saira Banu's 1975 film 'Saazish'. He said he didn't want to do the movie and hoped Saira would say no to the film but she agreed. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "I asked the producer to go and sign Saira, [it was] difficult to sign her those days. But Saira happily agreed."

79.title: Pune airport to get new terminal building at ₹475 cr by August 2023
79.article_body: The Pune airport is expected to get a new terminal building with enhanced capacity by August 2023. The construction work has been undertaken by the Airports Authority of India at a cost of ₹475 crore. The new and old terminal will have a passenger handling capacity of 1.6 crore passengers per annum.

80.title: Honest probe will identify culprits: Farooq on 'The Kashmir Files'
80.article_body: Reacting to the movie 'The Kashmir Files', ex-J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said that an honest investigation should be held to find out the culprits and the reason why such an incident occurred in the valley. He said, "Every film portrays...story in a unique way...It's important...the film portrays exact truth." The movie depicts the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the valley.

81.title: Fan comes up with 'Bachchhan Paandey' themed Holi colours, pics surface
81.article_body: A gulaal manufacturer from Lucknow, who is also a fan of actor Akshay Kumar, has come up with a "special edition" of Holi colours based on the film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. The packets of gulaal have a picture of Akshay from the movie with "Holi Ke Rang, Bachchhan Paandey ke sang" written on them. Holi will be celebrated on March 18.

82.title: Man claims hijab-wearing wife denied train seat, Mumbai Police chief says, 'Ridiculous'
82.article_body: A man, Dr Parvez Mandviwala, tweeted on Wednesday that his wife was denied a seat on a local train in Mumbai as she was wearing a hijab. Replying to the news report, Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey tweeted, "This is ridiculous." Mandviwala claimed few passengers insisted that saree-clad women get seated despite the fact that her wife carried their infant.

83.title: A proud moment: Viswanathan Anand on Chennai hosting 44th Chess Olympiad
83.article_body: Five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said it's a proud moment for all Indians that Chennai has been chosen to host the 44th Chess Olympiad. The Olympiad was scheduled to take place in Moscow but was shifted amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Chennai warmly welcomes all Kings and Queens from around the world!" tweeted Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin.

84.title: Pune to host conclave on alternate fuel from April 2
84.article_body: Pune will host an alternate fuel conclave from April 2 to April 5, Maharashtra government has announced. The 'Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave' is in line with the state government's policy towards accelerated adoption of e-vehicles, which government announced in 2021. "We need to act now to preserve our environment. New mobility is...very important," state Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said.

85.title: Punjab di aan, baan, shaan: AAP after Bhagwant Mann takes oath as CM
85.article_body: After Bhagwant Mann took oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on Wednesday, the AAP described him as "Punjab di aan, baan aur shaan". The swearing-in ceremony was held at  Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of Bhagat Singh. The AAP supporters wore 'basanti' turbans and dupattas at the ceremony.

86.title: Russian soldiers appear to be surviving on just potatoes, onions & pickles, claims video
86.article_body: Russia's army appear to be surviving on just three ingredients after Ukrainian troops seized a battlefield kitchen, according to reports. Video taken by Ukrainian troops shows an armoured vehicle fitted with a professional kitchen onboard. Its cupboards were stocked with just onions, potatoes and jars of pickles, according to the clip which was posted on Reddit.

87.title: Forcing male organ into vagina while victim is wearing underpants is rape: High Court
87.article_body: Meghalaya High Court held that if a man forced his male "organ into the vagina or urethra of victim despite the victim wearing her underpants", it'd amount to penetration for the purpose of Section 375(b), IPC. The court was hearing a case where a minor in 2006 complained the accused didn't penetrate but rubbed from the top of her underwear.

88.title: Will give internships, stipends: Mamata to students who returned from Ukraine
88.article_body: West Bengal will allow the medical students who returned from war-torn Ukraine to start internship at government medical colleges, said CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday. They will also be given stipends, she added. "For engineering students, the West Bengal government will arrange education in the state at nominal cost," she added while interacting with the students.

89.title: End Facebook, other social media giants' interference in India's democracy: Sonia
89.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday urged the government to put an end to the alleged "systematic influence and interference of Facebook and other social media giants in India's electoral politics." She also referred to a recent report published in Al Jazeera that claimed that election advertisements on Facebook promoted BJP more as compared to other political parties.

90.title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly loses billionaire status
90.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma briefly fell off the list of billionaires on Wednesday, according to Forbes' data, amid volatility in the stock's price movement. The stock recovered some losses on Wednesday after falling 70% below its IPO price in four months. Sharma's current net worth stands at $1.1 billion, as per Forbes' real-time data.

91.title: Tesla stops China plant production for 2 days amid COVID-19 curbs: Report
91.article_body: Tesla has halted production at its Shanghai factory for two days, without giving a reason, amid the COVID-19 restrictions in China to curb the country's latest outbreak, Reuters reported citing an internal notice. The factory staff were told the production would be suspended for Wednesday and Thursday. It delivered 56,515 vehicles in February, including 33,315 for export.

92.title: Auto driver murdered after a bar fight in Bengaluru; 2 arrested
92.article_body: A 32-year-old auto driver was allegedly bludgeoned to death by two people with a cement brick on Tuesday after a bar fight in Bengaluru. The accused had reportedly chased the victim for 500 metres, beat him with an iron rod and tube lights before bludgeoning him to death. The duo, who'd fled the scene, has been arrested by the police.

93.title: Tata Communications becomes Formula 1's official broadcast connectivity provider
93.article_body: Formula 1 and Tata Communications on Wednesday announced a multi-year strategic collaboration under which Tata will be F1's official broadcast connectivity provider. Tata Communications will facilitate transfer of over 100 video feeds and 250 audio channels from the racetrack to F1's Media & Technology Centre in the UK. F1 and Tata had ended their eight-year marketing partnership in January 2020.

94.title: Kerala Assembly passes unanimous resolution against LIC IPO
94.article_body: The Kerala Legislative Assembly on Wednesday passed a unanimous resolution against the Centre's decision to sell its stakes in insurance company LIC. The resolution, which was moved by Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, urged the Centre to retain its stake in the institution. Vijayan recalled that LIC was nationalised with an aim to protect stakeholders from the exploitation of private companies.

95.title: Taiwan using the Ukraine issue to validate their existence: China
95.article_body: China said Taiwan was "using the Ukraine issue to validate their existence and piggyback on a hot issue, taking advantage of other's difficulties". "Their attempts to incite confrontation, create hostility through political manipulation will not succeed," China's Taiwan Affairs Office spokeswoman Zhu Fenglian said. Taiwan has announced humanitarian aid for Ukraine and imposed sanctions on Russia.

96.title: Journalist shot dead in Mexico; 8th to be killed this year
96.article_body: A journalist working with Monitor Michoacan was shot dead on Tuesday in Mexico's Zitacuaro town. Armando Linares was the eighth journalist to be killed in the country this year. This comes weeks after Roberto Toledo, another journalist working with the same news outlet, was killed. Notably, Linares was the one to announce Toledo's death in a social media post.

97.title: I pray God gives courage to AAP to make prosperous Punjab: Gurdas Maan
97.article_body: Punjabi singer Gurdas Maan attended Punjab CM designate Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony on Wednesday and said that the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) ideology is special. "It's (AAP winning 92 seats in Punjab Assembly elections) just a beginning...I pray that God gives them (AAP) courage to make prosperous Punjab," Gurdas Maan added.

98.title: Anupam Mittal meets R Madhavan and Chetan Bhagat, shares picture
98.article_body: Shaadi.com founder and Shark Tank India fame Anupam Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with actor R Madhavan and author Chetan Bhagat. "After lot of time...an intimate evening with a few friends over weekend...made me feel that things are finally returning back to 'normal' after...2 years. Hope I am right @anusha_bhagat thanks for hospitality," he wrote.

99.title: Father, daughter killed, 21 others injured in crash in Muzaffarnagar
99.article_body: A man and his 10-year-old daughter were killed while 21 others were injured following a collision in UP's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday, police said. The incident occurred when a pick-up truck carrying the group of labourers was hit by another speeding truck near a village under Phugana police station, DSP Sharad Sharma said, adding, the injured labourers are in critical condition.

100.title: It's an honour to play alongside Jhulan Goswami: Mithali Raj
100.article_body: India Women captain Mithali Raj has said it's an honour to play alongside pacer Jhulan Goswami, who has become the first-ever woman bowler to claim 250 wickets in ODI cricket history. "It's difficult for any bowler to play at this level consistently," Mithali stated. Notably, Goswami is the only woman bowler to have over 200 wickets in ODIs.

101.title: 77 militants killed during infiltration attempts from Pak in 2021: Govt
101.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said a total of 77 militants were killed and 12 arrested while trying to infiltrate India from Pakistan in 2021. Moreover, 42 security force personnel died and 117 were injured in terror violence last year. Attempts of infiltration mainly took place in Jammu and Kashmir, he added.

102.title: Wish you had posted full video, not half-truth: Anupam to Kapil on invitation row
102.article_body: Anupam Kher reacted to Kapil Sharma thanking him for clarifying "false allegations" that he didn't invite 'The Kashmir Files' team to his show for not having a "big commercial star". Anupam wrote, "I wish you posted full video...not the half-truth." Anupam was referring to the video wherein he said Vivek Agnihotri was given "different reasons" for not inviting them.

103.title: It hasn't been easy mentally, it's crazy: Kylie on postpartum life
103.article_body: Kylie Jenner in a video said postpartum life since welcoming son Wolf "hasn't been easy" but rather "crazy". "I just want to say to my postpartum moms that postpartum hasn't been easy...it's...hard. This experience for me, personally, has been a little harder than with my daughter," she added. Kylie further assured her followers that it's "ok not to be ok".

104.title: Russia seeks 13-year-jail term for Putin critic Alexei Navalny
104.article_body: Russian prosecutors on Tuesday asked a court to sentence President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexei Navalny to 13 years in a maximum security prison on charges of embezzlement and contempt of court. Navalny is already serving a two-and-a-half-year sentence for parole violations at the prison colony. The prosecution request comes after Navalny urged Russians to protest the war in Ukraine.

105.title: Air travel may get costlier as ATF prices hit all-time highs after 18% hike
105.article_body: Air travel may get costlier as aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices were hiked by over 18%, the steepest ever increase, to all-time high levels on Wednesday. The prices crossed the ₹1-lakh-per-kilolitre mark for the first time ever after the sixth straight hike this year. Jet fuel makes up for almost 40% of the running cost of an airline.

106.title: White House mocks Russia for sanctioning Biden's father, says 'may he rest in peace'
106.article_body: White House press secretary Jen Psaki mocked Russia by saying that its retaliatory sanctions may have actually targeted US President Joe Biden's late father. "President Biden is a junior," Psaki told reporters, adding may his father "rest in peace". Russian government had omitted the junior suffix from his legal name, but later clarified that sanctions targeted "President J Biden".

107.title: 500 people taken hostage by Russia at Ukraine hospital; being used as 'human shields'
107.article_body: Russian troops seized control of a hospital in the city of Mariupol and are holding about 500 people hostage, according to regional leader Pavlo Kyrylenko. He alleged the hostages were being used as human shields. "It's impossible to leave the hospital, they are shooting hard," Kyrylenko said.

108.title: Cats evolved from 42 million-yr-old sabre-toothed predators: Research
108.article_body: According to research, cats have evolved from hypercarnivore, sabre-toothed predators that lived 42 million years ago in North America. They were among the first mammals to have an exclusively meat-based diet. The species was double in size of an average house cat and was fierce enough to take down animals such as rhinoceroses, camels, tapirs, pigs and horses.

109.title: Bhagwant Mann sworn in as Chief Minister of Punjab
109.article_body: Bhagwant Mann was on Wednesday sworn in as the Chief Minister of Punjab at Khatkar Kalan, the ancestral village of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh. Delhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal and other senior party leaders were present at the oath taking ceremony. The Aam Aadmi Party won 92 seats in the 117-seat Punjab Assembly.

110.title: India's accidentally fired missile nearly led to Pakistan retaliation: Report
110.article_body: An accidental missile fired by India last week nearly led to Pakistan retaliation, a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. Pakistan had prepared to launch a similar missile to strike India but held back because an initial assessment indicated something was amiss, the report added. India had said, "Technical malfunction led to accidental firing."

111.title: 90% of Ukrainians could face poverty if war drags on, warns UNDP
111.article_body: The UN Development Programme has warned that 90% of the Ukrainians could face poverty and extreme economic vulnerability if the Russia-Ukraine war drags on to next year. "We estimate that up to 18 years of development gains of Ukraine could simply be wiped out in a matter of 12 to 18 months," said UNDP Administrator Achim Steiner.

112.title: Polly is home: MI as Kieron Pollard arrives in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022
112.article_body: MI took to their social media handles to announce the arrival of all-rounder Kieron Pollard in Mumbai ahead of the IPL season. "Polly is home and we can't control our excitement!" wrote MI.  Ishan Kishan, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah have already joined the team's pre-season camp. MI will play their opening game against DC on March 27.

113.title: Avoided it, stories part of our sad reality: Gireesh on taking up Crime Patrol
113.article_body: Television actor Gireesh Sahdev, who will be playing SHO Ajit Singh in Crime Patrol 2.0, said that he avoided the show for the longest time. "When they tweaked the format...it absolutely fitted my bill...the stories told in the show are all true and very much part of the sad reality happening around us...that was more the reason," he added.

114.title: Akhilesh congratulates Punjab CM-designate ahead of swearing-in ceremony
114.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday congratulated CM-designate of Punjab, Bhagwant Mann, ahead of his oath-taking ceremony. "Many congratulations and best wishes to the newly elected CM of Punjab Bhagwant Mannji for the oath ceremony! Hope that under his able leadership, the crops of progress, brotherhood and new perspective will flourish in Punjab," Yadav tweeted.

115.title: Odisha govt declares dry day in state for urban polls from March 22
115.article_body: The Odisha government on Tuesday declared 'dry day' for five days from March 22 in view of the urban polls to be held on March 24. According to the letter, district magistrates and collectors have been ordered to ensure no liquor is sold or distributed by hotels or shops within polling areas from 5 pm of March 22 to 26.

116.title: HP govt to start batch-wise recruitment for JBT posts: CM Jairam Thakur
116.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government will soon begin batch-wise recruitment on vacant Junior Basic Training (JBT) posts in educational institutions, CM Jairam Thakur said on Tuesday. This will provide employment opportunities for trained youths, he said. Further, designations of BEd and TET qualified and eligible Shastri and language teachers would be changed to TGT (Sanskrit) and TGT (Hindi), he added.

117.title: Russian Prez Putin a 'war criminal': US Senate
117.article_body: The US Senate unanimously passed a resolution condemning Russian President Vladimir Putin as a "war criminal". The resolution called on the International Criminal Court to probe war crimes being carried out by Russia's military and Putin in Ukraine. "Putin cannot escape accountability for the atrocities committed against the Ukrainian people," Democratic Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said.

118.title: Pfizer asks US to allow 4th COVID-19 vaccine dose for people over 65
118.article_body: Pharma major Pfizer has sought approval for administering a fourth COVID-19 vaccine dose to people aged 65 and above in US. Pfizer and its German partner BioNTech cited data from Israel, where people aged over 60 are getting a second booster shot, to suggest that it would benefit the elderly. One booster is not good enough against infections, said Pfizer.

119.title: Actor Arslan Goni sustains eye injury after he slips on snow in Turkey
119.article_body: Arslan Goni was recently injured during the shoot of his film 'Love Ek Tarfa' in Turkey. While he was already nursing a nose injury, he, unfortunately, met with another accident. The actor slipped on snow and ended up with a bruised eye and other injuries on his face. On being contacted, Arslan confirmed getting hurt and said he's recovering well.

120.title: It didn't go our way despite batting first: Mithali on 2nd loss in Women's WC
120.article_body: India Women captain Mithali Raj said they need to work "very hard" on their batting in the upcoming games in the  Women's World Cup. "It didn't go our way despite getting what we wanted after losing toss," said Mithali after England chased down their 134-run total in 31.2 overs. "It's a relief, to be honest," said England captain Heather Knight.

121.title: Pat Cummins uses hammer to fix uneven Pakistani pitch, video goes viral
121.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins used a hammer to fix uneven pitch during the second Test against Pakistan in Karachi. The Pakistan Cricket Board took to Twitter to share a video, writing, "So Cummins is Thor?" A Twitter user commented, "For a change he is hammering the pitch and not batters."

122.title: Unfortunate but have to deal with it: Akshay on 'Bachchhan...' & RRR clash
122.article_body: When asked if the release of 'RRR' will affect the box office collection of 'Bachchhan Paandey', actor Akshay Kumar said, "Yes it obviously will, it's going to impact. Every movie is going to impact each other...The businesses are going to go down by 30% to 40%." "It's a very unfortunate thing but you have to deal with it," he added.

123.title: Golden rays of sun bring a new dawn: Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann
123.article_body: Ahead of being sworn in as Punjab CM on Wednesday, AAP leader Bhagwant Mann said that "golden rays of the sun" herald a new dawn for Punjab. "To realise the dreams of Shaheed Bhagat Singh and Baba Saheb, the whole of Punjab will take oath today at Khatkar Kalan," Mann tweeted today morning.

124.title: Tewari shares invite for Mann's oath ceremony; says 'wasn't invited for Channi's oath'
124.article_body: Senior Congress leader Manish Tewari has shared invite for Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony on Twitter. "I thank him for inviting me to his swearing-in. Due to Parliament being in session I will not be able to make it," he tweeted. "It is ironic I was not invited to Charanjit Channi's swearing-in though he was one of my MLAs," Tewari wrote.

125.title: Wouldn't it just be kickass: Ranveer on working with Ranbir in a film
125.article_body: Responding to a query from a fan on Instagram about working with Ranbir Kapoor in a film, Ranveer Singh said, "I have been trying for years. Wouldn't it just be kickass." "Manifest it," added Ranveer when asked about him and Shah Rukh Khan being seen together onscreen. Ranveer was recently named Best Actor at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards.

126.title: Biker held for snatching woman's purse from auto-rickshaw in Mumbai
126.article_body: A 32-year-old motorcycle-borne man was arrested by Oshiwara Police in Mumbai on Tuesday for allegedly snatching a woman's purse who was travelling in an auto-rickshaw and fleeing the spot. The incident took place near Shikhar Tower in a lane next to the Indian Oil petrol pump on March 7. The police traced the accused using CCTV cameras in the vicinity.

127.title: India drop to 3rd place on Women's World Cup points table as England post 1st win
127.article_body: India have dropped to the third place on 2022 Women's World Cup points table after suffering their second defeat in the tournament on Wednesday. England defeated India by four wickets to register their first victory in the tournament. England are now sixth on the points table which is led by Australia, who have won each of their first four matches.

128.title: I would like SRH to have a bit of a storyline: Batting coach Lara
128.article_body: SRH's strategic advisor and batting coach Brian Lara said, "I would like us to have a bit of a storyline where we go out as a team and the openers have a particular job." "In the nets a lot of aggression is pretty cool, but in the middle I would like to see it mixed with...thinking upstairs," added Lara.

129.title: Goibibo announces Holi giveaway of ₹150 crore free goCash
129.article_body: Aiming to make the festival of Holi a 'Full Vasool' celebration, Goibibo is giving away ₹150 crore goCash. 75 lakh customers will get a part of it for free. Additionally, Goibibo has many more 'Holi Super Deals' on the app such as Daily Steal Deals and bank offers, seeking to make sure every customer gets to travel this Holi weekend.

130.title: Amazon's $8.5-billion MGM deal cleared by EU antitrust regulator
130.article_body: The European Union's antitrust regulator has approved Amazon's proposed $8.5-billion acquisition of MGM Studios after concluding that the transaction "won't raise competition concerns" in Europe. Their combined market shares are low and they have strong rivals, the regulator noted. The deal, which is Amazon's second-biggest acquisition, is still pending approval by the US Federal Trade Commission.

131.title: Nursing intern assaulted for talking to woman colleague in Gurugram
131.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly abducting and assaulting a 19-year-old nursing intern in Gurugram for talking to a woman colleague. Police said that the accused allegedly barged into a private hospital and abducted the victim Sahil Khan. Police also said the woman was allegedly ignoring another man, Naresh Yadav, after which Yadav and his associates abducted Sahil.

132.title: 2 women arrested for stealing gold ring from jewellery shop in Pune
132.article_body: A 21-year-old woman and a 20-year-old woman were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly stealing a gold ring from a jewellery shop in Pune's Sahakarnagar area. The duo had entered the shop pretending to be customers, according to an FIR. The police have also recovered a bike from their possession, which they had reportedly stolen from the Hirabaug area.

133.title: After going unsold in mega auction, Suresh Raina to commentate in IPL 2022
133.article_body: Suresh Raina, who had gone unsold in the IPL mega auction, will be a part of the Hindi commentary team for the upcoming edition of IPL. Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri will also be a part of the Hindi commentary team for IPL 2022. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26 with KKR facing CSK in the opener.

134.title: I'd punish myself for eating in my 20s; I was quite horrible: Jacqueline
134.article_body: During an interaction with actress Shilpa Shetty, actress Jacqueline Fernandez said she didn't know how to handle the pressure of being on an international platform. Jacqueline added she'd punish herself for eating. "In my 20s I did go through...lot of eating issues...It happened because of my pageant days...I didn't know how to handle it. Food became the enemy," she added.

135.title: 25-year-old Saqib Mahmood to make Test debut for England against WI
135.article_body: Pacer Saqib Mahmood is set to make his Test debut for England in the second Test against West Indies after Mark Wood was ruled out due to an elbow injury he suffered in the first Test. The 25-year-old right-arm pacer has played seven ODIs and 12 T20Is, picking a total of 21 wickets. The first Test had ended in draw.

136.title: 3 terrorists killed in encounter in Srinagar's Nowgam: J&K police
136.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Wednesday said that they killed three unidentified terrorists in the Nowgam area of Srinagar. They said that the encounter broke out after the militants opened fire on the security forces during a search operation in the area based on intelligence. "Incriminating materials including arms and ammunition were recovered," they added.

137.title: Bhagwant Mann's daughter and son reach India to attend his swearing-in ceremony
137.article_body: The daughter and son of Aam Aadmi Party leader Bhagwant Mann have reached India from the US to attend his swearing-in ceremony in Punjab's Khatkar Kalan. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM today at the ancestral village of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh. Inderpreet Kaur, who separated from Mann in 2015, said that Mann was always in her prayers.

138.title: 7-yr-old kidnapped for 'human sacrifice' on Holi by UP man wanting to get married
138.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was kidnapped from Uttar Pradesh's Noida by her neighbour for "human sacrifice" on Holi. The girl's neighbour, who was finding it hard to get married, had consulted an occultist, who suggested him the method to please the gods in order to get married. The occultist has been identified but is at large, the police said.

139.title: Ukraine Prez gets 3-min standing ovation after speech to Canada's Parliament
139.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy received a three-minute standing ovation after a speech to the Canadian Parliament on Tuesday. Canadian PM Justin Trudeau led the applause after describing the Ukrainian President as a "champion for democracy". Zelenskyy had addressed the Parliament via video link and asked for more assistance in its fight with Russia, including a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

140.title: Builder arrested for cheating flat owners of ₹11 crore in Ghaziabad
140.article_body: A builder was arrested for allegedly duping 51 flat owners of ₹11 crore on pretext of providing them flats in a housing complex in Raj Nagar Extension near Ghaziabad. The accused had promised buyers of giving them possession within three years of booking their flats in 2012, a police official said. However, the project is incomplete till date, he added.

141.title: 2 held in Thane for illegally selling tickets at higher rates
141.article_body: Two persons were arrested by the Railway Protection Force (RPF) in Thane for illegally selling tickets to people at higher rates. The accused, hailing from Raboli, allegedly booked the tickets from their private IRCTC accounts and sold them to people. The police seized large number of long distance train tickets, a computer and mobile phones from the accused.

142.title: Chiranjeevi welcomes Salman on-board for Godfather, says 'It's an absolute joy'
142.article_body: Actor Salman Khan will be a part of actor Chiranjeevi's upcoming film 'Godfather'. Taking to Twitter, Chiranjeevi shared the news with his fans and followers and wrote, "Bhai...Your entry has energised everyone and the excitement has gone to the next level. Sharing the screen with you is an absolute joy. Your presence will no doubt give that magical #Kick to...audience."

143.title: Prepare to fight against dynastic politics: PM to BJP lawmakers
143.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while interacting with the BJP lawmakers asked them to prepare for a fight against dynastic politics across the country. PM Modi said not giving tickets to the kin of BJP leaders was his decision. "Agar yeh paap hai to maine yeh paap kiya hai (if this is a sin, then it's my sin)," PM Modi stated.

144.title: Colleague stabs cook after argument over how to cut cheese in Gurugram
144.article_body: A 22-year-old cook, Sourav was allegedly stabbed by a colleague after an argument over cutting cottage cheese at Gurugram restaurant. Sourav told police that he asked the accused, Vishnu, to cut cottage cheese into smaller pieces as he had sliced bigger pieces. Enraged with this, Vishnu started hurling abuses at him, when objected, he stabbed Sourav with the same knife.

145.title: NIA files chargesheet against 6 in 2021 Jalalabad bomb blast case
145.article_body: The NIA has filed a chargesheet against six people, including Khalistani operative Lakhbir Singh Rode, in connection with the bomb blast which took place in September 2021 in Punjab's Jalalabad. One person, the bomb-planter, was killed in the incident. Earlier, the gang had set ablaze a car and a few shops in Ferozepur city, said NIA.

146.title: Delhi govt orders inspection to check food adulteration ahead of Holi
146.article_body: Ahead of the festival of Holi, the food safety department of Delhi government has ordered random inspection of eateries and food businesses to check for food adulteration. The order directed the officials to especially inspect samples of sweets. Last year, about 400 people fell sick in April after eating adulterated buckwheat flour in Delhi's Kalyanpuri area.

147.title: Man suspected of shooting 5 homeless people arrested in US’ Washington
147.article_body: A 30-year-old man suspected of shooting five homeless men, killing two of them, was arrested in US' Washington. The perpetrator, identified as Gerald Brevard, has been charged with homicide, assault with a dangerous weapon and assault with intent to kill, said police. Earlier, the police released his photos and announced a reward of $55,000 for information on his whereabouts.

148.title: Entire Punjab will pledge: Kejriwal on Bhagwant Mann’s swearing-in ceremony
148.article_body: The entire Punjab will come together today and take a pledge to make a prosperous Punjab, Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal tweeted on Wednesday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Punjab's CM designate Bhagwant Mann. "To witness that historic moment, I have also left for Khatkar Kalan, the native village of Shaheed Bhagat Singh," Kejriwal tweeted.

149.title: Delhi police asked to make security arrangements after 'The Kashmir..' release
149.article_body: After the release of 'The Kashmir Files', Deputy Commissioners of Police (DCPs) in Delhi have been asked to make security arrangements. "Movie is based on lives of Kashmiri Pandits...trailer purported to portray Muslims slaughtering Kashmiri Pandits...injuring community's sentiments," a letter to DCPs said, adding, "Adequate police arrangements...suggested, especially in mixed population areas."

150.title: Workers invade Luv Ranjan's film sets over non-payment of ₹1.2 crore: Reports
150.article_body: Protesting alleged non-payment of ₹1.2 crore, scores of workers invaded the sets of director-producer Luv Ranjan's upcoming film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor, reports said. They reportedly claimed that around 350 people who had worked on a song for the film in October last year had not been paid the amount. Police were reportedly called on the sets.

151.title: I don't know why the Russians shot me: 9-yr-old Ukrainian girl after losing her arm
151.article_body: Sasha, a nine-year-old Ukrainian girl who lost her arm in a Russian attack, said that she doesn't know why the Russians shot her. "I hope it was an accident and that they didn't mean to hurt me," she added. Sasha's father was killed after the Russian troops opened fire on their car as they were fleeing a Kyiv suburb.

152.title: Russia's space chief, who called Musk 'little devil', invited him home 6 months ago
152.article_body: Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin, who called Tesla CEO Elon Musk a "little devil" after he challenged President Vladimir Putin for a single combat, praised Musk six months ago. Rogozin even invited Musk to his home in Russia in September and said he'd "already set the teakettle on heat". Rogozin wanted to discuss "exploring the universe" with Musk.

153.title: What's the point of taking pressure over price tag: GT's ₹9-crore buy Tewatia
153.article_body: All-rounder Rahul Tewatia, who was bought for ₹9 crore by Gujarat Titans, has said he's not feeling any pressure over his price tag and wants to fulfil the role for which he was bought in the auction. He added, "The team is showing belief in you and that's why they are ready to spend that kind of money on you."

154.title: Today is an important day: PM as India starts COVID vaccination of 12-14 age group
154.article_body: As India started vaccinating children aged 12 to 14 years, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Today is an important day in India's efforts to vaccinate our citizens." "Now onwards, youngsters in the 12-14 age group are eligible for vaccines and all those above 60 are eligible for precaution doses. I urge people in these age groups to get vaccinated," he wrote.

155.title: Influencer whose pic was wrongly printed on wanted poster sues US police for ₹230 crore
155.article_body: A female Instagram influencer whose picture was wrongly printed on wanted poster has sued the New York City Police Department for $30 million (nearly ₹230 crore) in damages. Eva Lopez said that the poster caused "emotional distress". Lopez was vacationing in Florida in 2021 when she saw the wanted poster for the first time.

156.title: Russian news editor who protested against war on state TV fined 30,000 roubles
156.article_body: The Russian woman who held a "No War" sign during live state TV news bulletin to protest against the attack on Ukraine was fined 30,000 roubles (approximately ₹21,000) by a court. She was held guilty of flouting protest legislation. Marina Ovsyannikova, a mother of two, had pleaded not guilty and was released after she paid the fine.

157.title: Five dead, 17 injured in road accident in Chhattisgarh
157.article_body: Five people died and 17 were injured after a tractor-trolley collided with a truck in Gariaband district of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, police said. All the victims belonging to Majarkatta were returning from a function in Mohlai. An ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for families of the deceased and ₹50,000 each for the injured was announced by Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel.

158.title: Peace talks with Russia sounding more realistic: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
158.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the peace talks with Russia are beginning to "sound more realistic" after nearly three weeks of the war. "However, time is still needed for the decisions to be in the interests of Ukraine," he said in a Facebook address. The talks, which are being held via video conference, are due to continue on Wednesday.

159.title: PM talks like Atal Bihari Vajpayee but doesn't act like him: Shashi Tharoor
159.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi, at times, displayed certain traits of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee by saying the right things but the difference is that those right words have not translated into actions. "If only he can start implementing some of the thoughts that he has said publicly, he might serve the country better," Tharoor added.

160.title: Vadodara constable's wife allegedly dies by suicide, family alleges torture
160.article_body: Vadodara Police has launched a probe after alleged suicide of a constable's 25-year-old wife. The family of deceased, Ankita Aparthy, has alleged domestic violence and mental torture in the case. "My sister was being mentally harassed for several months. She had been complaining to us and has been murdered...Her husband has not even come to meet us," Ankita's brother said.

161.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu resigns as Punjab Congress chief
161.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu has resigned as the Punjab Congress chief. This comes after Congress President Sonia Gandhi asked the state heads of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur to resign from their posts to reorganise the Pradesh Congress Committees. "As desired by the Congress President I have sent my resignation," Sidhu tweeted.

162.title: Muslims shouldn't think this judgement is against them: Assam CM on hijab verdict
162.article_body: After the Karnataka High Court upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the court's judgement is logical. "Schools/colleges should have a uniform dress code. Muslims should not think that this judgement is against them," Sarma added. "This judgement is in the right step towards implementing the diktat of the Quran," Sarma stated.

163.title: I don't even know what insecurity is: Akshay on being compared to other actors
163.article_body: Speaking about being compared to other actors, Akshay Kumar said that he doesn't even know what "insecurity" is. He added that when he entered Bollywood it was a huge thing for him to just get to look at his poster. "It was a [big] deal for me to just be able to work with someone like Sanjay Dutt," Akshay said.

164.title: 45-yr-old man killed in hit and run accident in Chandigarh
164.article_body: A 45-year-old petrol pump employee died in a hit and run accident after he was mowed down by an unknown vehicle near Matka Chowk, Chandigarh, on Tuesday morning. The man was heading towards Press Light point from Matka Chowk on his two-wheeler at around 7:45 am when a rashly driven vehicle ran over him, according to the police.

165.title: Absconding don’s illegally constructed properties demolished in Meerut
165.article_body: Six shops and a factory “illegally constructed” in a government park in Meerut’s Transport Nagar area were demolished by the local district administration on Tuesday, officials said.  Police said they were constructed by local don Badan Singh alias Baddo, who later sold it to others. Baddo is wanted in several cases and is carrying a reward of ₹2.5 lakh.

166.title: Elon Musk changes his Twitter name to 'Elona' as Putin's ally calls him effeminate
166.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk changed his Twitter name to 'Elona' after Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally and the Chechen Republic's head Ramzan Kadyrov mocked him as "effeminate". Kadyrov said, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's." "You'll need to pump up those muscles...to change from the gentle (effeminate) Elona into the brutal Elon you need to be," he added.

167.title: Don't really understand the point of this: Neesham on new 'catch out' rule for batters
167.article_body: Reacting to MCC's new rule that new batters will face next delivery after a player is given out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken, New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "I don’t really understand the point of this." He added, "Has this rule ever been a problem? Also rewards batsmen who don't stay aware of match situation."

168.title: Sensex jumps 900 points in early trade, Nifty above 16,900
168.article_body: The Indian benchmark indices opened higher on Wednesday amid positive global cues. In early trade, the Sensex jumped more than 900 points to trade near 56,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 250 points to trade above 16,900 levels. Banks and financials, including IndusInd Bank and Axis Bank, were among top Sensex gainers.

169.title: Bad phase began after heartbreak with Amy, I disappeared completely: Prateik
169.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said "bad phase" in his life began after he had a heartbreak with his 'Ekk Deewana Tha' co-star Amy Jackson. "I fell in love with that woman (Amy)...it just went haywire...Heartbreak at 25 years old hits different...Then I completely disappeared," he added. Amy and Prateik reportedly dated each other in 2012 but broke up soon after.

170.title: India buying discounted crude oil from Russia does not violate US sanctions: US
170.article_body: India taking up Russia's offer of discounted crude oil would not be a violation of US sanctions, the White House has said. "Our message to any country continues to be that abide by the sanctions that we have put in place and recommended," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki told reporters at a press briefing on Tuesday.

171.title: It's not over yet: Babar on his century while chasing Aus' 506-run target
171.article_body: Chasing a 506-run target, Pakistan ended Day 4 at 192/2, needing 314 runs to win the second Test against Australia. Reacting to it, captain Babar Azam, who's unbeaten at 102, said the match is not over yet. "We need to continue playing in the same way," he added. Babar and Abdullah Shafique have added 171 runs for the third wicket.

172.title: Contamination due to cracks in old pipeline led to diarrhoea outbreak in Guj
172.article_body: Cracks in the 40-year-old pipeline that supplies drinking water to the Kalol municipality in Gujarat led to its contamination causing diarrhoea outbreak in the area, State Health and Family Welfare Minister Nimishaben Suthar said on Tuesday. An eight-month-old infant has died and 554 residents have complained of vomiting and diarrhoea with 93 hospitalisations in Kalol since March 6.

173.title: Three men arrested for raping woman in J&K's Poonch
173.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police arrested three men for allegedly raping and threatening a woman with death in Jammu & Kashmir's Poonch. The woman in her complaint alleged that an acquaintance of hers called her to his place to discuss marriage and took her to an abandoned house. He then called two of his neighbours there and raped her, she claimed.

174.title: India reports 2,876 COVID-19 cases, 3,884 recoveries in the 24 hours
174.article_body: India has reported 2,876 new COVID-19 cases, 3,884 recoveries, and 98 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
