This comes a day after the country reported 2,568 cases and 97 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,072, while the active caseload declined to 32,811.

175.title: It'll be support for invasion: US on if India buys discounted crude oil from Russia
175.article_body: On being asked about possibility that India could take up Russian offer of discounted crude oil, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "Think where you want to stand when history books are written in this moment in time." "Support for Russian leadership is support for invasion that is having a devastating impact," she further said.

176.title: Tripura govt hikes wage of tea garden workers by ₹31
176.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Deb on Tuesday announced a hike in the wages of the tea garden workers in the state by ₹31. The wages will be increased from the existing ₹105 to ₹136 under the 'Mukhyamantri Cha Shramik Kalyan Prakalp' scheme. "Over 7,000 families dependent on 54 tea estates spread across Tripura are going to benefit directly," said Deb.

177.title: Hijab verdict disappointing, can be widely misused: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind
177.article_body: Calling Karnataka High Court's verdict upholding hijab ban "deeply disappointing", Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has said that the decision will have "a direct impact on religious freedom" and affect education of Muslim girls. It said that the verdict could be misused in other contexts. "Using this verdict as a precedent, any religious practice can be called into question," said an official.

178.title: It won't matter if you don't give Akshay food, but give him work: Farhad
178.article_body: Filmmaker Farhad Samji, who has directed Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey', said, "It won't matter if you don't give Akshay food but give him work. He even wakes up with the dedication that 'I want to work'." "I have seen this side of Akshay sir where if somebody did not get their payment someday, he would give them money," added Farhad.

179.title: Manchester United knocked out of Champions League by Atletico
179.article_body: Manchester United have been knocked out of the Champions League after their 0-1 defeat against Atletico Madrid on Tuesday night in the second leg of the round of 16. Atletico advanced 2-1 on aggregate after a draw in the first leg last month. Meanwhile, Benfica have also advanced to the quarterfinals with a 3-2 aggregate in the last-16 against Ajax.

180.title: Circuit was a stupid role; did Munna Bhai because of Sanjay Dutt: Arshad
180.article_body: Arshad Warsi said it's important for him to know who's the lead actor of the movie, before signing a film. "I did 'Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.' because it was Sanju (Sanjay Dutt), otherwise even Raju (filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani) knows that it's a stupid role," he added. "It really is on paper...Even (actor) Makrand Deshpande had said no to 'Circuit'," Arshad said.

181.title: Ex-Meta employees' crypto startup turns unicorn with $200 mn funding
181.article_body: Former Meta employees' cryptocurrency startup Aptos has turned unicorn after raising $200 million led by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z). Others who participated in the funding include Tiger Global, Katie Haun, Multicoin Capital, Three Arrows Capital, FTX Ventures and Coinbase Ventures among others. Aptos CEO Mo Shaikh and CTO Avery Ching had left Meta in December.

182.title: Women's panel seeks report from Pune police over stabbing of class 10 girl
182.article_body: The Maharashtra State Commission for Women has sought a report from Pune City Police on the knife attack on a class 10 girl by a 21-year-old man at her school farewell in Pune on Monday. The accused, who's suspected of stalking the 15-year-old girl and making one-sided advances, allegedly attempted suicide by consuming a poisonous substance after stabbing the victim.

183.title: 2 Mumbai police officers suspended after theft suspect commits suicide
183.article_body: A police sub-inspector and constable of the MHB Colony were suspended by the Commissioner for allegedly delaying the probe in a theft case leading to the suspect's suicide. Raj Pawar had allegedly committed suicide last week after he was accused of stealing a bike. His family claimed the policemen threatened Pawar and accepted a bribe of ₹20,000 from his mother.

184.title: People used to recognise me; I used to cover face, go out with Haarsh: Bharti
184.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said she used to cover her face while going out with husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa. "Haarsh used to ask if we can go out to have pakodas...I used to tie cloth on my face...was doing Comedy Circus...People used to recognise me," Bharti said, adding she thought she will be scolded in Punjab if someone proposed marriage in Mumbai.

185.title: Pant can become a better wicketkeeper-batter than MS Dhoni: Jaffer
185.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said that Rishabh Pant can "definitely" become a better wicketkeeper-batter than MS Dhoni. "At such a young age, he has already played some...incredible knocks. In the coming 8-10 years...he will be more mature," stated Jaffer. Pant recently scored the fastest Test fifty by an Indian off 28 deliveries in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

186.title: Man molests 2-yr-old girl by luring her with biscuits in Pune, held
186.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a two-year-old girl in Pune's Bopkhel area after luring her with biscuits. "Parents had both gone for work and girl was alone. He offered her biscuits and took her to forested land at 12:30 pm," police said, adding that the child was found with wounds on her cheeks and hands.

187.title: Russia bans Justin Trudeau and over 300 Canadians from entering the country
187.article_body: Russia has put Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and over 300 Canadians on a 'stop list' that bans them from entering the country. The list includes Foreign Minister Melanie Joly, Defence Minister Anita Anand, and almost all MPs. The move came after Canada sanctioned several Russian officials over its invasion of Ukraine. Russia also banned US President Joe Biden's entry.

188.title: SL captain Karunaratne responds to Harsha Bhogle's tweet after over 2 years, gets trolled
188.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne has been trolled after he responded to a congratulatory tweet by Harsha Bhogle that was posted more than two years ago. "Is everything alright?" a user tweeted. Other tweets read, "Stop using Internet Explorer" and "My brother just searched his name and replied to every tweet he found because...he thought he's just being noticed now."

189.title: 8 held for forging property papers, cheating buyers in Bengaluru
189.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested a gang of eight, including two rowdy-sheeters, for allegedly forging property papers of sites on fabricated old stamp papers and selling them to unsuspecting buyers. The accused reportedly sold many sites worth ₹8 crore in and around Bengaluru. Police have recovered 2,130 fake stamp papers, 17 fake sub-registrar office seals, and a typewriter from the gang.

190.title: 6-yr-old girl dies as speeding car hits her on road near her house in Pune
190.article_body: A six-year-old girl died after speeding car hit her in Pune's Kunjirwadi on Sunday. Incident took place when she was on the road near her house. Police said that the car was speeding from Solapur towards Pune. Case under Sections 279, 304(a) of Indian Penal Code along with Sections 184, 132(1)(c), and 119/177 of Motor Vehicle Act has been registered.

191.title: North Korea's missile launch fails
191.article_body: North Korea fired an "unidentified projectile" on Wednesday but the launch appears to have immediately failed, South Korea's military said. Japanese media reported that North Korea had launched a possible ballistic missile, citing an unnamed defence ministry official. North Korea has so far carried out nine weapons tests this year.

192.title: DDA approves 80 hectare redevelopment plan of AIIMS Delhi
192.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority has approved redevelopment of 79.73 hectares of land for AIIMS Delhi's expansion. As part of the plan, a dedicated infectious diseases ward, 50 new operation theatres and a smart library will be built. The plan envisages 1.5 lakh sqm area for state-of-the-art research laboratories, animal facilities, and a clinical trial facility.

193.title: Squatters occupy £50 million UK mansion linked to Russian oligarch
193.article_body: A group of squatters broke into a London mansion that belongs to the family of sanctioned Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska and hung signs that read 'This property has been liberated' and 'Putin go f*** yourself'. The squatters staged a demonstration on the balcony of the £50 million (around ₹500 crore) mansion, saying they were reclaiming it for Ukrainian refugees.

194.title: Any noise meter app's data can now be used to file complaints in Mumbai
194.article_body: Noise pollution complaints in Mumbai can now be lodged based on any noise monitoring application's data, Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey said. "Citizens can download any free noise meter, take a reading of the decibel level...and lodge a complaint," he said. Pandey had earlier directed major developers to install noise cutters around construction sites in the city by March 31.

195.title: Kapil Sibal doesn't know 'ABC of Congress': Rajasthan CM Gehlot
195.article_body: Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday criticised fellow party leader Kapil Sibal's remarks on suggesting change in Congress' leadership. Reacting to it, Gehlot stated that Sibal doesn't understand "ABC of Congress", adding that it isn't expected of Sibal to make such statements. Sibal's comments came after Congress' defeat in the recently held Assembly elections in five states.

196.title: Belarus resisting attempts to drag it into Ukraine war: President
196.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko said on Tuesday that the country had intercepted a missile fired at it from Ukraine two days back, but will not engage in the conflict. Lukashenko's comments came after Ukrainian government accused Russia of staging "false flag" air attacks on Belarus from Ukraine in a bid to incite Belarus to join the war.

197.title: Bailable warrant against Shilpa's mother over ₹21 lakh loan case
197.article_body: A Mumbai court on Tuesday issued a bailable warrant against actress Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda in a case over alleged non-repayment of a ₹21 lakh loan. The case was filed by a businessman who claimed that Shilpa's father Surendra had borrowed the money in 2015. Earlier, a summons had been issued to Sunanda and Shilpa and her sister Shamita.

198.title: Gandhi family is heart of party workers: Maharashtra Congress chief
198.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Tuesday said the Gandhi family is heart of Congress workers and Rahul Gandhi will become Congress president by following due process. "Those leaders who are raising questions today should first talk about what they did when they got opportunity," he added. On Monday, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said party leadership is in cuckoo land.

199.title: Australia to lift entry ban for international cruise ships after 2 yrs
199.article_body: Australia is set to lift its entry ban for international cruise ships from April onwards, in a move aimed to further ease COVID-19 restrictions. The current ban that has been in effect since March 2020 will not be renewed beyond April 17, the Australian government has confirmed. Last month, Australia reopened its international borders to vaccinated travellers.

200.title: Was all about love but never thought about marriage: Shama Sikander
200.article_body: Actress Shama Sikander, who tied the knot with American businessman James Milliron on Monday, said she never thought about marriage. "I was all about love and I still am...but the marriage was something that was not on my (mind)," she stated. "It's because I have seen what happens in marriage and because of the condition I come from," Shama added.

201.title: Frivolous: HC dismisses PIL alleging Delhi CM has Khalistani links
201.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday refused to entertain a public interest litigation petition seeking an inquiry against Aam Aadmi Party and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, alleging that they have links with Khalistani separatists. A Division Bench of Acting Chief Justice Vipin Sanghi and Justice Navin Chawla remarked that the petition was 'completely frivolous'.

202.title: Navy man stabbed by stranger in Mumbai's Azad Maidan after argument
202.article_body: A manhunt has been launched after a 24-year-old navy man was stabbed in his ribs by an unknown person in Mumbai's Azad Maidan on Monday. The victim, Sivnath Ramniwas Singh, was confronted by the unknown person for sitting inside the ground till late which led to an argument. Singh was rushed to the hospital after police received an alert.

203.title: Leaked pic from 'Pathaan' set shows SRK's transformation with 8-pack abs
203.article_body: New pictures have emerged from the shoot of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Pathaan' in Spain. These show the physical transformation the actor has undergone for the movie. One of the pictures that has surfaced on social media showed him with eight-pack abs. The picture showed Shah Rukh in his long-hair look for the movie.

204.title: Daniil Medvedev smashes racquet on court, Monfils' reaction goes viral
204.article_body: World number one Daniil Medvedev smashed his racquet on the court in frustration during his Indian Wells Masters round of 32 match against Gaël Monfils. Following this, Monfils mocked Medvedev by pretending to clean up the court with towel. Medvedev lost 6-4, 3-6, 1-6. Medvedev will lose his world number one spot when the rankings will get updated on Monday.

205.title: U'khand Cong chief resigns after party's defeat in Assembly polls
205.article_body: Uttarakhand Congress chief Ganesh Godiyal resigned from his position following the party's defeat in Assembly elections, adding that he takes moral responsibility for the loss. Godiyal's resignation came after Congress chief Sonia Gandhi asked the state party heads of UP, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Manipur and Goa to step down, citing the need for reorganisation. Congress won 19 seats in Uttarakhand.

206.title: Our very own boy from Indore has arrived: KKR on Venkatesh ahead of IPL
206.article_body: KKR took to Twitter to announce the arrival of Venkatesh Iyer in their squad in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022. "Our very own boy from Indore has arrived," wrote KKR. The Indore-born all-rounder was retained by the franchise for ₹8 crore before the IPL mega auction last month. Venkatesh had scored 370 runs from 10 matches in IPL 2021.

207.title: PSL must switch from draft to auction model to match IPL level: Shoaib Malik
207.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik said if Pakistan Super League (PSL) wants to match the level of IPL then they should consider moving to auction model to attract biggest stars of the game. The league is currently following the drafting system with a set money cap. Earlier, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja proposed the new model on same lines.

208.title: 3 people jailed for 3 years over illegal leopard trade in MP
208.article_body: A special court in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur has sentenced three persons to three years in jail for illegal leopard trade. The convicts were arrested in 2020 by the State Tiger Strike Force (STSF) and leopard skin and other remains were confiscated from them, Deputy Conservator of Forests, Rajneesh Singh said. He added 44 relic bones were also seized after raids.

209.title: UP gangster Ankit Gujjar's aide arrested with guns in east Delhi
209.article_body: An associate of UP gangster Ankit Gujjar, whose death in Tihar Jail prompted a CBI probe, was arrested from northeast Delhi's Welcome area. Police said the accused, Amit Dedha, who was also associated with Rohit Chaudhary's gang, was part of an inter-state arms racket. Police said two semi-automatic pistols and 17 live cartridges, besides a stolen scooter, were recovered.

210.title: Plot to push back Muslim girls failed: Kerala Governor on hijab row
210.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan on Tuesday welcomed Karnataka High Court's decision to uphold the ban on hijab in educational institutions and said, "Conspiracy to push back young Muslim girls has fallen flat". He further added, "Hijab has been mentioned seven times in the Quran, but not in the context of dress code."

211.title: Pak court acquits President Alvi in 2014 Parliament attack case
211.article_body: Pakistan's President Arif Alvi, Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi and a few other senior leaders of the ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party were acquitted in the 2014 Parliament House attack case. PM Imran Khan had already been acquitted in the case in October 2020. The incident had taken place during PTI's sit-in against the then PML-N government.

212.title: People wish journalist named Aamir Khan on actor's birthday, journalist says 'Thanks'
212.article_body: Several Twitter users wished actor Aamir Khan on his birthday on Monday by tagging the handle @thereal_aamirk, that belongs to a journalist named Aamir Khan. Reacting to this, the journalist tweeted, "Thanks for all the wishes, on the birthday of actor Aamir Khan, who is NOT on Twitter." The actor turned 57 years old on Monday.

213.title: Alia's fan distributes sanitary napkins, ration kits on her b'day
213.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's fan Deep Jaiswal along with his Team Planet Alia Bhatt distributed sanitary pads and ration kits to girls in Ranchi to celebrate the actress' 29th birthday. Deep took to Twitter to share pictures from the event, adding that they also explained the importance of menstrual hygiene. Alia replied to the tweet, writing, "Bestest gift ever!! So grateful."

214.title: K'taka HC's decision on hijab row should be welcomed: Rajnath Singh
214.article_body: After the Karnataka High Court upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions on Tuesday, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the decision of the HC should be "welcomed". Everyone must follow the dress code of the school or college irrespective of their religion, said Singh, while addressing a program on "Women Transforming India" in Delhi.

215.title: India had 8.22 cr taxpayers in FY20, will identify more soon: FM
215.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said India had 8,22,83,407 taxpayers in FY20 out of the total projected population of 136.30 crore (as on March 1, 2021). This includes persons who pay income tax and corporate tax. "The (tax) department seeks to bring more non-filers into the tax net by formulating region-specific strategies...for identifying potential non-filers," she added.

216.title: Fox News cameraman among 2 journalists killed while reporting in Ukraine
216.article_body: Journalists Pierre Zakrzewski and Oleksandra Kuvshynova were killed while reporting in Ukraine on Monday. Zakrzewski was a veteran Fox News cameraman and his death was confirmed by the US news network on Tuesday. Kuvshynova was a Ukrainian journalist and his death was confirmed by Anton Gerashchenko, an advisor to the Ukrainian Interior Minister.

217.title: Majority of Indian students chose to stay in Ukraine: Jaishankar
217.article_body: While talking about the repatriation of Indians from war-hit Ukraine, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said a majority of students chose to stay back as they didn't want their studies to be affected. "Some universities actively discouraged and showed reluctance to offer online courses," he said, adding that this led to nearly 18,000 students being stuck when the conflict began.

218.title: Rohit has got more grey hair since taking over captaincy, jokes Mahela Jayawardene
218.article_body: Mumbai Indians took to Twitter to share a video of Rohit Sharma joining the squad ahead of IPL 2022. In the video, Rohit can be seen meeting the support staff of the franchise. "He's got more grey hair since taking over the captaincy," Mumbai Indians head coach Mahela Jayawardene can be heard jokingly saying in the video.

219.title: Punjab AAP MLAs raid govt offices, say corrupt officials 1st target
219.article_body: Days after winning the Assembly elections, four Aam Aadmi Party MLAs of Punjab's Moga district raided various government offices, including the civil hospital and said that corrupt officials were their first target. They also met with Deputy Commissioner Harish Nair and Senior Superintendent of Police Charanjit Singh Sohal and complained about the harassment of the public in government offices.

220.title: Tesla hikes car prices in US, China for second time in a week
220.article_body: Tesla has hiked the prices of its electric vehicles in the US and China for a second time in a week. The development comes after its CEO Elon Musk highlighted that Tesla is facing significant inflationary pressure in raw materials and logistics. While Tesla's cheapest car now starts at $46,990 in US, its top-end model's price has increased to $138,990.

221.title: Man electrocuted to death in MP while talking on charging phone
221.article_body: A man died of electrocution in Madhya Pradesh's Indore while talking to his wife over a mobile phone which was reportedly connected to a charging point. According to a report, the deceased's brother ran to his room after hearing him scream and found him lying on the ground. The man was then rushed to hospital where he was declared dead.

222.title: 19-yr-old man arrested by ATS of UP Police for planning to join LeT
222.article_body: The Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Uttar Pradesh Police on Monday arrested a 19-year-old man for allegedly being in touch with a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operative and for planning to go to Pakistan for arms training. "We learnt that Haq (accused) was in touch with people from Afghanistan, Pakistan, Bangladesh through different WhatsApp groups for over Jihad," said a police officer.

223.title: 2 men kill friend over sarcastic comment in Karnataka; arrested
223.article_body: Police have arrested two men who allegedly killed their friend in Karnataka's Davanagere district earlier this month after he passed a sarcastic remark about them. The deceased had sustained serious injuries and passerby had thought it was a bike accident. However, the victim's mother later filed a complaint suspecting it to be murder, according to a report quoting SP Hanumantharaya.

224.title: Don't use Russian anti-virus Kaspersky, there's serious risk of hacking: Germany to users
224.article_body: Germany's cyber security agency warned users against using Kaspersky anti-virus software developed by Russia-based Kaspersky Lab. Germany said the software poses a serious risk of a successful hacking attack and that the company could be coerced by Russian government agents to hack IT systems abroad. Kaspersky has said it is a privately-managed company with no ties to the Russian government.

225.title: TMC MLA says 'Ek Bihari, sau bimari', BJP leader shares video
225.article_body: TMC MLA Manoranjan Bapari sparked a controversy by calling people from Bihar a disease. "If you love your mother tongue and motherland, then you have to shout...'Ek Bihari, sau bimari'," he said in a video. Sharing the video, BJP's Suvendu Adhikari asked Patna-born Shatrughan Sinha, who was named as TMC candidate for by-polls, how he felt about these comments.

226.title: Over 1,500 wildlife crimes reported in 3 years in Gujarat
226.article_body: Over 1,500 cases under Wildlife Protection Act were reported in Gujarat between July 2018 and June 2021, according to state government. Maximum cases (358) were registered in the Gir Somnath region followed by Junagadh (315), state Forest Minister Kiritsinh Rana informed on Monday. He further said that 347 fire incidents were reported from wildlife sanctuary pockets between 2019 and 2020.

227.title: I feel euphoric: Anupam on 'The Kashmir Files' box office collection
227.article_body: Talking about the domestic box office collection of his film 'The Kashmir Files', actor Anupam Kher said, "I feel euphoric...Only cinema can do that." He added that 'The Kashmir Files' will be used as a case study of how cinema and audiences have changed. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, has collected ₹42.20 crore since four days of its release.

228.title: FEUOK to ban Dulquer Salmaan movies over his film's OTT release
228.article_body: The Film Exhibitors United Organisation of Kerala (FEUOK) has announced that movies featuring actor Dulquer Salmaan or made by his production house Wayfarer Films will be banned from theatres in Kerala until further notice. This comes after Dulquer's upcoming film 'Salute', which was scheduled for a theatrical release, will now be released on an OTT platform.

229.title: 5.3 lakh police posts vacant in India, over 1 lakh in UP: Govt
229.article_body: Over 5.3 lakh posts are lying vacant in various police stations in India, Minister of State for Home Affairs, Nityanand Rai informed Lok Sabha, adding that over 1 lakh posts are pending in UP. As per data by the Bureau of Police Research and Development (BPR&D), sanctioned strength of police is 26,23,225, actual strength is 20,91,488, leaving 5,31,737 posts vacant.

230.title: Kanye West is the 'Donkey of the Day': Charlamagne tha God
230.article_body: American radio host Charlamagne tha God has called rapper Kanye West 'Donkey of the Day', adding, "This is all coming from a place of love." His comment comes after Kanye has been publicly asking ex-wife Kim Kardashian to reconcile. "You just mad that Pete Davidson is with Kim Kardashian. He's done nothing to you, your ex-wife chose him," Charlamagne said.

231.title: A lot of hue & cry over remakes, audience doesn't give a damn: Amit
231.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh said there's "a lot of hue and cry" over remakes and adaptations, however, added that the audience does not care about it. "You give [the audience] a good story, convincing performances...fun, they're okay," he stated.  "If you want to make a Malayalam film into a pan Indian film, why not? It's about your intention," he added.

232.title: BR Ambedkar's statue found damaged in MP village, probe underway
232.article_body: A statue of Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar has been found damaged in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore district. According to reports, police was informed of the damage by some villagers following which additional force was deployed in the village to prevent any untoward incident. Police said they have launched a probe into the matter and a case had been registered against unidentified miscreants.

233.title: Video of Tom, Tobey & Andrew creating 'Spider-Man' meme goes viral
233.article_body: A behind-the-scenes video of Spider-Man actors Tom Holland, Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield recreating the three Spider-Men meme has been going viral on social media. The actors were seen together in 2021 film 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Tom, Tobey and Andrew can be seen laughing and joking around as a compilation of dialogues from the film plays in the background.

234.title: 2 MP workers fired after dry & wet waste mixed during trash collection
234.article_body: Two contractual employees in MP's Indore were fired after dry and wet waste was found mixed in a door-to-door garbage collecting vehicle. Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Pal terminated the workers' services while she was on inspection at Zone No 7. This comes ahead of the central team's visit to the city for assessing its cleanliness standards under Swachh Survekshan 2022.

235.title: 325 died while cleaning septic tanks in last 5 yrs: Union Minister in LS
235.article_body: Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment, Ramdas Athawale, in the Lok Sabha today informed that 325 people died while cleaning sewers and septic tanks during the last five years. The maximum number of people died in Uttar Pradesh (52). However, no death has been reported because of engaging in manual scavenging, he further said.

236.title: Thousands protest against govt in Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
236.article_body: Tens of thousands of people took part in anti-government protests in Sri Lanka's capital Colombo on Tuesday, amid one of the country's worst economic crises. The protesters accused the government of mismanaging the economy and creating a foreign exchange crisis. The crisis has led to shortages of essential items like fuel, cooking gas, milk powder and medicines.

237.title: Fire breaks out at Agra's SN Medical College, patients evacuated
237.article_body: A fire broke out at an eight-storey building of SN Medical College in UP's Agra on Tuesday following which patients were evacuated. Chief Medical Officer Dr Arun Srivastava said the fire started from the garbage in the hospital's basement. He added the incident led to a stampede-like situation as people rushed to exit the building, however, no casualties were reported.

238.title: 2 Bhopal locals arrested in Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen terrorists case
238.article_body: Two Bhopal residents were detained by Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) of Madhya Pradesh for their alleged link with four Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen (JMB) members arrested on Sunday. Police said they have been detained for interrogation for allegedly harbouring the JMB members and providing logistic support. A senior officer said they're being questioned to find out if they're aware of JMB members' motives.

239.title: 17-yr-old girl, boyfriend arrested for killing her parents in UP
239.article_body: A 17-year-old girl has been arrested along with her 20-year-old boyfriend in UP's Bijnor for killing her parents for opposing their marriage plans. The girl tried to present her father's death in his house as natural but a relative grew suspicious as her mother had also died under similar circumstances, police said. The pair admitted the crime after being detained.

240.title: 16-yr-old raped by neighbour on pretext of marriage in Guj; booked
240.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was impregnated after being allegedly raped multiple times by a man in Gujarat's Halvad town on the pretext of marriage. The accused, Jignesh Tadvi, was booked after the victim's mother lodged a complaint with the police on Sunday night. Police said that the accused is currently absconding and a search is on to find him.

241.title: Ukraine's Parliament extends martial law for a month from March 26
241.article_body: Ukrainian Parliament on Tuesday voted to extend the martial law for another 30 days from March 26. This comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy submitted a bill to the house late on Monday, March 14 regarding the same. Meanwhile, the UN said at least 691 civilians including 48 children were killed in Ukraine between February 24 and March 14.

242.title: ₹1-crore fine among penalties for bio-bubble breach in IPL 2022
242.article_body: In its operational rules for IPL 2022, BCCI said if a team wilfully allows a person into the bio-secure bubble to have contact with players/support staff, it could face punishment up to ₹1 crore. In case, someone misses COVID-19 test, a warning will be issued for first offence and subsequent offences will result in a fine of ₹75,000 per offence.

243.title: 3 Indians stranded in Ukraine's Kherson evacuated via Moscow: MEA
243.article_body: Three Indians stranded in Ukraine's Kherson have been evacuated via Simferopol and Moscow, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said on Tuesday. "They boarded their flight from Moscow a short while ago and the Indian Embassy in Russia has facilitated their transit and accommodation en route," said Arindam Bagchi, spokesperson of the MEA.

244.title: South Korea reports record 293 COVID-19 deaths in last 24 hours
244.article_body: South Korean authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 293 COVID-19 deaths in last 24 hours, recording the highest death toll since the pandemic began. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), 1,196 patients were reported to be in a critical condition in the same period. Meanwhile, the country logged 3,62,338 cases on Tuesday.

245.title: No strong or weak team in T20 cricket: DC assistant coach Agarkar
245.article_body: DC assistant coach Ajit Agarkar said there's no strong or weak team in T20 cricket, adding there's enough evidence throughout the editions of IPL that no team is easy to beat. "If you see RR in...first edition of IPL, everyone was having a laugh at the team they picked in...auction, but they went on to win the trophy," he added.

246.title: More Afghans are going hungry since Taliban takeover: World Bank
246.article_body: A World Bank survey has found that the number of people in Afghanistan who cannot afford food and other essentials has doubled since the Taliban takeover of the country in August last year. The economic crisis was sparked after international donors cut financial aid to the country. Over half of Afghanistan's population faces starvation, the UN had warned.

247.title: Going to be an exciting finish: Ashwin after Babar's ton in Pak-Aus Test
247.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin praised Pakistan captain Babar Azam for scoring a century in second innings of Pakistan-Australia second Test. "[It's] going to be an exciting finish tomorrow," he tweeted. Pakistan are 192/2 at stumps on Day 4, with Babar on 102* and Abdullah Shafique unbeaten on 71. Chasing a 506-run target, Pakistan need 314 more runs to win.

248.title: Russia bans Joe Biden, other top US officials from entering its soil
248.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry said that US President Joe Biden and other top officials have been banned from entering the country in a reciprocal response to US sanctions. The measure, which also applies to Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, "is the consequence of the extremely Russophobic policy pursued by the current US administration," said Russia.

249.title: Paytm share price drops 71% from IPO price; out of BSE top-100 mcap list
249.article_body: Paytm shares dropped to an all-time low of ₹616.55 apiece on Tuesday, leading it to drop out of the BSE top 100-most valued companies by market capitalisation. Following RBI's order on Paytm Payments Bank, its shares crashed 20% in the last two trading sessions. Notably, its share price has dropped 71% from its issue price of ₹2,150 apiece.

250.title: Amazon's demand for $200 mn caused Amazon-Future settlement talks to fail: Report
250.article_body: The dispute settlement talks between Amazon and India's Future Retail failed over the US company's demand for the return of at least $200 million it had invested in Future, Reuters reported. Future instead offered a stake of an equivalent amount in one of its remaining group companies after Reliance takes over most of its retail assets. Amazon didn't accept that.

251.title: Bobby was nervous about speaking Haryanvi in 'Love Hostel': Shanker
251.article_body: 'Love Hostel' director Shanker Raman revealed Bobby Deol was nervous about speaking Haryanvi in the film. Shanker said Bobby started working on it a month before the film's shooting began and added the actor completely surrendered himself. "We would have dinner on location...he would just say his lines to me, like a child, happy to have learned them," Shanker stated.

252.title: SoftBank's Munish Varma steps down from Paytm, PolicyBazaar boards
252.article_body: Paytm on Tuesday informed stock exchanges that Munish Varma, Managing Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers, has resigned from Paytm's board "due to personal commitments and other pre-occupations". He has also resigned from Policybazaar's board. Varma's resignation is consistent with Softbank's move globally, as it steps away from board positions after its portfolio companies get listed.

253.title: Better to touch it than never being world no. 1: Daniil on losing top spot
253.article_body: Daniil Medvedev, who will lose his world number one ranking to Novak Djokovic on Monday, said it's better to be number one for "one week in life" than to never "touch" it. Medvedev claimed the top spot on February 28. The Russian lost the ranking after losing to Frenchman Gael Monfils in Indian Wells Masters third round on Monday.

254.title: Will be with family for a while: Sandra on taking break from acting
254.article_body: Actress Sandra Bullock said she will be taking a break from acting "for a while" to focus on her family. Adding that it's 24/7 work, Sandra said that she takes her job as an actor very seriously when she's at work. "I just want to be 24/7 with my babies..my family...That's where I'm gonna be for a while," she added.

255.title: Pakistan logs 473 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
255.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 473 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 4 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to 30,313. NCOC added that out of 18,026 active cases, 560 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 1.37% from 1.48%.

256.title: Myanmar's military has committed crimes against humanity: UN
256.article_body: Myanmar's military has committed war crimes and crimes against humanity since it took power in a coup, the UN said. Security forces have shown a flagrant disregard for human life, the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, Michelle Bachelet, said. Many victims were shot in the head, burned to death, arrested arbitrarily, tortured, or used as human shields, she added.

257.title: Frankfurt Airport cancels 130 flights amid strike by security staff
257.article_body: Authorities at Germany's Frankfurt Airport cancelled 130 out of 818 flights on Tuesday as airport's cargo and passenger control employees went on strike. This comes amid wage dispute between Verdi trade union and Federal Association of Aviation Security Companies (BDLS). While trade union raised host of demands including an hourly raise of at least €1, BDLS has refused to comply.

258.title: BJP-BSP had tacit understanding on 122 seats in UP polls: SBSP chief
258.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) founder OP Rajbhar on Tuesday claimed that the BJP and Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) had a tacit understanding on 122 Assembly seats in UP. "122 seats in Purvanchal are such on which candidates were decided at BJP office and symbols were given at BSP office. I can provide evidence for the same," he alleged.

259.title: In worst debt of my life, anyone else in my place would've died by suicide: Kaaranvir
259.article_body: TV actor Kaaranvir Bohra has said that he is currently under "the worst debt" of his life, adding, "I have at least three-four cases on me for not paying the money back." He added, "Since 2015, whatever work I accept is to pay off the debt...Had anyone else been in my position, he would've died by suicide," said Bohra.

260.title: Meta fined $19 million by Ireland over a series of data breaches
260.article_body: Irish watchdog has imposed €17 million ($19 million) fine on Meta Platforms for failing to prevent a series of 12 personal data breaches on Facebook in 2018. "We found that Meta Platforms failed to have in place appropriate technical and organisational measures," the Data Protection Commission (DPC) said. "This fine isn't about a failure to protect people's information," Meta said.

261.title: Delhi Metro to start services after 2.30 pm on Holi, buses to run after 2 pm
261.article_body: Delhi Metro services won't be available till 2:30 pm on all lines, including the Airport Express Line, on Holi this Friday, the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said. Services will start at 2:30 pm from terminal stations on all lines and will continue normally thereafter, it added. DTC bus services will also start after 2 pm on Holi.

262.title: Ukraine realises it can't join NATO, says President Zelenskyy
262.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said the country realises that it can't join NATO. Speaking  to representatives of the UK-led Joint Expeditionary Force (JEF), Zelenskyy said that "we heard for years about the allegedly open doors" of NATO, but "we have already heard that we won't be able to join". He added that "it's the truth we must recognise".

263.title: Whenever I DM him, I get a reply: Pune engineer who is Twitter friends with Musk
263.article_body: A 23-year-old engineer from Pune, who is Twitter friends with the world's richest man Elon Musk said that they converse on various subjects and Musk is very "straightforward". Pranay Pathole added, "He's super friendly. It doesn't feel like you are interacting with the world's richest person...He's very active on Twitter...because whenever I DM him, I get a reply within...minutes."

264.title: Udupi schools & colleges to reopen tomorrow, section 144 to continue
264.article_body: Schools and colleges in Karnataka's Udupi will reopen on Wednesday after being shut on Tuesday in view of the HC's judgment on the hijab ban issue. However, prohibitory orders imposed under CrPC section 144 will continue till March 21, banning processions, celebrations and protests, the Deputy Commissioner said. The HC upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

265.title: 2,000 civilian cars left besieged Mariupol: Ukrainian officials
265.article_body: Around 2,000 civilian cars have been able to leave the besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol along a humanitarian evacuation route, the city council said on Tuesday. A further 2,000 vehicles were waiting to leave the city, it added. The Russian forces have blockaded and bombarded Mariupol, with supplies in the city running low.

266.title: K'taka hijab case petitioners vow to attend classes only in hijab
266.article_body: Girls who are seeking permission to wear hijab inside educational institutions vowed to "fight for justice and [their] rights" and attend classes only in hijab. "The Constitution itself provides us (our rights) to follow my religion and wear whatever we want," one of the girls said. Karnataka HC today held prescription of uniform as a reasonable restriction.

267.title: Oppn's lack of cooperation led to BJP's win in Assembly polls: Alagiri
267.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC) chief KS Alagiri on Monday said the BJP won Assembly polls in four states due to lack of cooperation among opposition parties. "To defeat...BJP and PM Modi [in 2024 Lok Sabha elections] opposition...should start working together from today," he added. Alagiri added that Congress cadres across the country want Rahul Gandhi to lead the party.

268.title: Man fakes religious identity, rapes 19-yr-old & films act in J'khand
268.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested on the charge of raping a 19-year-old a month back and for filming the act to blackmail her in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district, a police officer said on Tuesday. The victim, in her complaint, said that the accused had allegedly faked his religious identity and befriended her some time ago.

269.title: Woman who held 'No war' poster on Russian TV on trial, faces 10 days in prison
269.article_body: Marina Ovsyannikova, the woman who interrupted a live news bulletin on Russian state TV channel with a 'No war' poster, is on trial and faces ten days in prison, said AFP. She was detained after she ran on to set holding the sign. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron said he'd discuss offering protection for her with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.

270.title: MEA did commendable job: Cong MP on evacuation from war-hit Ukraine
270.article_body: Congress MP Anand Sharma praised the Ministry of External Affairs for evacuating Indians from war-hit Ukraine. "Work done by the MEA, diplomats, and Indian Missions abroad is commendable," he said. He also narrated an incident regarding one student and said he contacted Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla at 1:00 am for help and received a response at 1:22 am.

271.title: His 1st reply was my life's highlight: Pune engineer on being Twitter friends with Musk
271.article_body: A 23-year-old Pune engineer revealed how he became friends with world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter. In 2018, then 2nd year engineering student Pranay Pathole tweeted to Musk about Tesla's automatic screen wipers, to which Musk responded instantly. Adding that their interactions are casual now, Pathole said Musk's first response was the "highlight" of his life.

272.title: Australian govt’s 'Women’s Network' withdraws logo over criticism
272.article_body: Women's Network, a volunteer-based collective in the Australian Prime Minister's department, has withdrawn its logo after receiving criticism over it. The logo consisted of a cursive W with a domed protrusion, giving it an apparent resemblance to male genitalia. The group clarified that the "Prime Minister's office wasn't part of this logo design".

273.title: Expect to evacuate our citizens from Ukraine's Mariupol soon: Turkey
273.article_body: Turkey's Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu said on Tuesday that the country expects to evacuate its citizens from Ukraine's Mariupol soon. He added that 14,800 Turkish citizens had been evacuated from Ukraine so far amid the Russian invasion. Çavuşoğlu's comments came after Russian forces attacked a mosque in Mariupol last week where over 80 people, including Turkish citizens, had sought refuge.

274.title: ₹7.34 lakh crore recovered by banks since FY16: MoS Finance
274.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad on Tuesday said banks have recovered ₹7,34,542 crore in the last six financial years and in the first six months of FY22. This includes recoveries in cases of non-performing assets and written-off loan accounts. He added that systematic and comprehensive checking led to unearthing of frauds perpetrated over the years.

275.title: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in Apr-Jun 2021 amid 2nd wave
275.article_body: India's urban unemployment rate jumped to 12.6% in April-June 2021 from 9.3% in the previous quarter amid COVID-19's second wave, according to data released by the government. The rise in unemployment in the second quarter of 2021 was the first such increase since the jobless rate peaked at 20.8% in April-June 2020, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said.

276.title: Beating Federer at 2014 Davis Cup final was a big moment: Monfils
276.article_body: World number 28 Gael Monfils said that defeating 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer at Davis Cup final in 2014 was a "big moment" for him. "It was an important match," he added. Monfils beat Federer in second match and levelled the tie 1-1. However, Switzerland won the next two matches to win their first-ever Davis Cup title.

277.title: Marshals, throw him out: Rajasthan Speaker evicts MLA from Assembly
277.article_body: Rajasthan MLA Sanyam Lodha was evicted from state Assembly by Speaker CP Joshi on Tuesday after he disrupted proceedings of the House. "Marshals, throw him out. I'll not allow it," Joshi ordered. Lodha, who was demanding the release of a man jailed for four years on a murder charge, entered the Well of the House and raised slogans against police.

278.title: Didn't realise I was pregnant for 2.5 months: Comedian Bharti Singh
278.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said she didn't realise that she was pregnant for the first two and a half months. She jokingly added, "Mote logo ka pata nahi chalta." Bharti revealed she and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa were surprised when they found out about the pregnancy. "We didn't plan that this is the right time to have a baby," she stated.

279.title: Swara Bhasker indirectly targets 'The Kashmir Files' in her tweet, Twitter users react
279.article_body: Swara Bhasker's tweet, wherein she seemed to indirectly speak about Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', sparked reactions on Twitter. "People are asking why prominent Bollywood stars haven't said a word of appreciation for getting people back in cinemas. Operative word being 'prominent'," a comment read. Another Twitter user agreed to her tweet and commented, "Well said."

280.title: Cong heads of 5 states asked to resign post-Assembly poll defeat
280.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday asked the party's state heads of Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Goa and Manipur to resign from their posts. This is being done to reorganise the Pradesh Congress Committees of these states. Congress won only two of 403 seats in UP, 19 of 70 seats in Uttarakhand and 18 of 117 seats in Punjab.

281.title: Alibaba, Tencent lose over $1 trillion in market value over a year
281.article_body: Chinese technology giants Alibaba and Tencent have lost more than $1 trillion in combined market value over the last 13 months. The stocks of Chinese tech companies plunged over the past year as the government extended its regulatory crackdown. While food delivery platform Meituan's market value has plunged by $254.6 billion since February 2021, e-commerce platform Pinduoduo lost $217.6 billion.

282.title: Unseen hands at work to engineer unrest: K'taka HC on hijab case
282.article_body: As it passed the verdict on the hijab controversy on Tuesday, a three-judge bench of the Karnataka High Court commented that some "unseen hands are at work to engineer social unrest and disharmony". "We are dismayed as to how all of a sudden...the issue of hijab is generated and blown out of proportion by the powers that be," HC said.

283.title: Actor Puneeth's elder brothers break down at 'James' event
283.article_body: Puneeth Rajkumar's elder brothers Raghavendra Rajkumar and Shivarajkumar got emotional while remembering the late actor during an event for Puneeth's film 'James'. "I can't tolerate [Puneeth's death] anymore, I'm ready to leave," Raghavendra said. Shivarajkumar broke down listening to Raghavendra and said, "It pained me a lot to see [Raghavendra] speak like that...[Puneeth] was everyone's pet."

284.title: EU to propose 'amber' category for gas, nuclear energy investments
284.article_body: EU chief advisor Nathan Fabian on Tuesday said bloc will shortly propose a new category 'amber' for not-fully green investments such as gas, nuclear energy. This comes after Fabian had opposed including both as green investments. Notably, gas, nuclear energy play a role in transition towards green fuel as they are low-carbon but produce greenhouse gases and radioactive waste respectively.

285.title: Ukraine's region warns of air raids, urges citizens to take shelter
285.article_body: Authorities in Ukrainian region of Chernihiv on Tuesday issued a nationwide warning of air raids by Russian forces. They also urged the citizens to take shelter. However, it was not clear if other regions in the country had issued similar warnings. Meanwhile, UN said at least 636 civilians were killed in Ukraine from February 24 to March 13.

286.title: New Zealand's new policy offers visas to 4,000 Ukrainian refugees
286.article_body: New Zealand on Tuesday said that it will offer 4,000 special visas to family members of Ukrainian-New Zealanders under a new policy in a response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. It's New Zealand's largest special visa category in decades, Immigration Minister Kris Faafoi said. Nearly 30 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began in February, the UN said.

287.title: HC asks Sharad Yadav to vacate govt bungalow in Delhi in 15 days
287.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday asked former JD(U) chief Sharad Yadav to vacate the government bungalow occupied by him within 15 days as he was disqualified as Rajya Sabha MP in 2017. The court said there was no justification for Yadav to retain the bungalow. Yadav was elected to the Rajya Sabha in 2017.

288.title: Zomato loans $150 mn to Blinkit, buys 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 mn
288.article_body: Zomato is loaning $150 million to Blinkit (formerly Grofers) as per its plan of investing $400 million cash in Indian quick commerce over the next two years. The loan's interest rate will be 12% p.a. or higher with a tenor of not more than one year. Zomato is also acquiring a 16.66% stake in Mukunda Foods for $5 million.

289.title: Deep Ocean Mission will bolster observations in Indian Ocean: Centre
289.article_body: Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary M Ravichandran on Monday said Deep Ocean Mission will strengthen observational network in Indian Ocean. He added the system will help capture long term changes in the ocean's climatic conditions. Reportedly, eight deep ocean gliders, 48 argo floats and 150 wave drifters will be added in coming years as part of the ₹4,000 crore mission.

290.title: Over 13,500 Russian troops killed since war began: Ukraine
290.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Ministry on Tuesday said over 13,500 Russian troops were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. The ministry added that 404 tanks, 81 aircraft and 95 helicopters belonging to Russian forces were destroyed so far. Meanwhile, UN said at least 636 civilians including 46 children were killed from February 24 to March 13 in Ukraine.

291.title: Amazon's ad campaign laughable, attempt to confuse Indian govt: CAIT
291.article_body: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said it finds Amazon's claims in a paid public advertisement "sanctimonious and laughable". "They are nothing but a pathetic attempt at buying media legitimacy and confusing the Indian government...about Amazon's persistent violations of India's FDI laws," it added. The traders' body further said the contents of the public notice are mala fide.

292.title: Which states have declared the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free?
292.article_body: At least eight states have declared the movie 'The Kashmir Files', which stars Anupam Kher, Mithun Chakraborty among others, as tax-free. The film, based on the 1990 exodus of Hindus from Kashmir Valley, will be tax-free in UP, Goa, Tripura, MP, Karnataka, Haryana, Gujarat and Uttarakhand. Karnataka government also said it'll screen the film in state Assembly on Tuesday.

293.title: Babar smashes Test hundred after 2 years, pulls off Suryakumar Yadav-like celebration
293.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam smashed his first Test hundred after over two years by reaching the three-figure mark in the second innings of the Karachi Test against Australia off 180 deliveries. Babar celebrated his hundred first with a roar and then pulled off a Suryakumar Yadav-like 'Keep calm, I am here' celebration while pointing towards his teammates.

294.title: Lewis Hamilton to change name to include his mother Carmen's surname
294.article_body: Seven-time Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton has revealed that he will change his name to incorporate his mother Carmen's original surname, Larbalestier. "I don't really fully understand the whole idea that when people get married the woman loses her name and I really want my mum's name to continue on with the Hamilton name," he added.

295.title: Pakistan Cricket Board planning to introduce women's PSL early next year
295.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja said the board is planning to introduce a Pakistan Super League (PSL) for women in January next year with foreign players. "We've to take steps to have a proper domestic calendar for women with three-day matches," he added. Meanwhile, Pakistan have lost all its opening four matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

296.title: 3 arrested for ₹6 cr heist at Belagavi cooperative bank in K'taka
296.article_body: Belagavi Police has arrested three people, including a bank clerk, for robbing the Belagavi District Credit Cooperative Bank of cash and ornaments worth nearly ₹6 crore. Cash worth ₹4.2 crore and three kilograms of gold and silver ornaments worth ₹1,63,72,220 have been recovered. The accused have been identified as Basavraj Hunshikatti, Santosh Kalappa Kambar and Yamanappa Laxman Belwal.

297.title: Ukraine crisis shows need for reform in UNSC: Japan Foreign Minister
297.article_body: Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi said on Tuesday that Russia-Ukraine crisis has highlighted need for reforming United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Hayashi's comment comes weeks after Russia, which is a permanent member of UNSC, vetoed a draft resolution that demanded Moscow to withdraw its troops from Ukraine. US, UK, France and China are the four other permanent members of UNSC.

298.title: 15-month-old girl run over by truck outside shanty in Gr Noida
298.article_body: A 15-month-old girl child was killed on Tuesday morning after a truck ran over her outside her shanty in Greater Noida's Surajpur area. "As soon as we received the information about the incident, the police staff was rushed to the spot," an official said. A truck bearing Haryana's registration number ran the girl over, the official added.

299.title: Over 4,800 flats in Pune on list of lapsed projects in Maharashtra
299.article_body: The 407 projects that lapsed in Maharashtra in 2021 include 4,852 flats in 92 Pune housing projects of which 51% flats are sold, property consultants ANAROCK said after analysing MahaRERA data. A project is considered lapsed if developer fails to complete it on time, making it difficult for owners to mortgage or sell properties as banks won't finance the project.

300.title: B'luru records 61 new COVID cases, 0 deaths on Monday; 229 recover
300.article_body: Bengaluru recorded 61 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths on Monday. Data released by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) revealed that 229 people were discharged or have recovered from the virus in the city in the last 24 hours. A total of 7,311 coronavirus tests were done in the city on March 14 and 8,140 vaccine doses were administered.

301.title: Ukraine's Prez asks for more weapons from European nations amid war
301.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday urged European nations to send more weapons to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces invading the country. "We all are the targets of Russia and everything will go against Europe if Ukraine won't stand," he said. "So I would like to ask you to help yourself by helping us," Zelenskyy added.

302.title: Those cutting, damaging trees to celebrate Holi to be penalised: BMC
302.article_body: BMC on Monday said action will be taken against Mumbai residents cutting or damaging trees for Holi celebrations. "If anybody is caught, that person can be imprisoned for seven days or one year and may also have to pay a penalty between ₹1,000 and ₹5,000," an official said. Civic officials will keep an eye with help of surveillance teams.

303.title: Gurugram hotel manager buys ₹2 lakh gold with guest's debit cards
303.article_body: A hotel manager in Gurugram was arrested for allegedly stealing debit cards of a guest and making transactions worth ₹3.1 lakh, police said. The manager had accompanied the 60-year-old guest to an ATM to withdraw money for paying his hotel bill. Since the elderly man was allegedly drunk, the accused withdrew ₹1 lakh cash and bought gold worth ₹2.1 lakh.

304.title: Israeli forces kill 2 Palestinians in West Bank: Palestine ministry
304.article_body: Palestine Health Ministry on Tuesday said Israeli forces killed two Palestinians and injured several others in two separate raids in occupied West Bank. As per Israeli border police, one of the Palestinians was neutralised after he opened fire at the police during an operation at Balata refugee camp. Police added another Palestinian died during a raid at Qalandia refugee camp.

305.title: Freedom of religion not absolute in India like in US: HC in hijab verdict
305.article_body: In its verdict on the hijab controversy, the Karnataka High Court said that freedom of religion is subject to restrictions in India and it's not like in US or Australia, where it is defined in absolute terms. "Whichever be the religion, whatever is stated in the scriptures, does not become per se mandatory in a wholesale way," the court said.

306.title: I lead 3 lives, for people, camera & close ones: Siddhant Chaturvedi
306.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that he leads three lives, the first being for the people, the second for the camera, and the third for his friends and family. "Apart from the poems I write, I don't think a lot of people have access to the third part of my life," he added. Siddhant stated that he likes it that way.

307.title: 3 EU leaders to visit Kyiv amid war to show support for Ukraine
307.article_body: Prime Ministers of European Union members Slovenia, Poland and the Czech Republic are on their way to Kyiv on Tuesday amid attacks by Russian forces on the Ukrainian capital. The aim is "to confirm the unequivocal support of...European Union for the sovereignty...of Ukraine", Czech PM Petr Fiala said. Major road and train routes from Kyiv are still open.

308.title: Albie Morkel joins Bangladesh as power-hitting coach for ODI series vs SA
308.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Albie Morkel has been appointed as power-hitting coach of Bangladesh ahead of their upcoming ODI series against South Africa, confirmed Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) Cricket Operations Chairman Jalal Yunus. Notably, this is the first time that Bangladesh has appointed a power-hitting coach. The 40-year-old has represented South Africa in one Test, 58 ODIs and 50 T20Is.

309.title: B'luru man sues restaurant for charging 40 paise extra, fined ₹4,000
309.article_body: A Bengaluru man who sued a restaurant for overcharging him 40 paise has been fined  ₹4,000 by a court. He was ordered to pay the amount as compensation to Hotel Empire on Central Street after claiming that the incident caused him "mental shock and agony". The court imposed the fine for wasting its time for his personal publicity.

310.title: Govt has no plans to introduce cryptocurrency: MoS Finance
310.article_body: The government is not planning to introduce a cryptocurrency that will be regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday. Cryptocurrencies are currently unregulated in India, he added. ''RBI doesn't issue cryptocurrency. Traditional paper currency is a legal tender and is issued by RBI," he clarified.

311.title: US employee moves into office cubicle, says 'job doesn't pay enough'; evicted
311.article_body: An employee in the US moved into a cubicle at his office, claiming that he can't afford to live in an apartment due to his low income. Simon documented his living conditions through TikTok videos, which showed how he stores his food and clothes at the office. He was evicted from the office after his videos and pictures went viral.

312.title: DU to allow students to complete their final exams, obtain degrees
312.article_body: Delhi University will allow students who could not complete their degrees to return and take their final exams as a part of its year-long centenary celebrations starting on May 1. Responding to a question at the Lok Sabha on Monday, Minister of State for Education Dr Subhas Sarkar informed that the university will conduct examinations twice during the centenary year.

313.title: Turkmenistan President's son wins snap presidential election
313.article_body: Turkmenistan's Central Election Commission on Tuesday said Serdar Berdimuhamedov, son of outgoing President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov, won the snap presidential election. Serdar secured nearly 73% votes with his nearest rival in a field of nine candidates mustering just 11%. In power since 2007, the outgoing President called the snap election last month paving way for a generation of new leaders.

314.title: PNB reports fraud of over ₹2,000 crore in NPA account of ITPCL
314.article_body: The Punjab National Bank on Tuesday reported a fraud of ₹2,060 crore in the NPA account of IL&FS Tamil Nadu Power Company Ltd (ITPCL). The bank said it has already made provisions amounting to ₹824.1 crore as per prescribed prudential norms. In February, Punjab & Sind Bank had declared IL&FS Tamil Nadu a fraud account with dues of ₹148 crore.

315.title: Fake railway recruitment drive cheats people of ₹10 crore in Hyd
315.article_body: A fake railway recruitment drive in Hyderabad that cheated people out of over ₹10 crore was busted by the police, following which two people were arrested. Police said a preliminary estimate revealed that the drive defrauded over 100 job aspirants while promising to provide them jobs through backdoor entry processes without examination. Officers recovered ₹9 lakh, two cars and documents.

316.title: Sky turns orange after hot air dumps dust from Sahara desert in Spain, pics surface
316.article_body: The skies in parts of Spain have turned orange after a mass of hot air from the Sahara desert dumped dust after crossing the Mediterranean. Storm Celia brought dust from the desert to southern parts of Spain, with Madrid and Murcia among the places lit up. Spanish officials issued extremely poor air quality ratings.

317.title: Didn't sign H'wood film for heck of it or to tick off box: Alia Bhatt
317.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that she did not sign Hollywood film 'Heart of Stone' for the heck of it or to tick it off the box. "I want to look at opportunities which...have a good part, an interesting dynamic and cast, something that is new and relevant," she said. This will mark Alia's Hollywood debut with actress Gal Gadot.

318.title: Ananya is an important part of Ishaan's life: Neliima Azeem
318.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter's mother Neliima Azeem has called actress Ananya Panday an important part of his life, adding that they are great buddies and good companions. Neliima further said Ananya is a part of their inner circle as well as their family circle. Ishaan and Ananya worked together in 2020 film 'Khaali Peeli' and have sparked dating rumours since then.

319.title: He can replace Chahar in CSK for IPL 2022: Irfan on 19-yr-old Hangargekar
319.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said 19-year-old pacer Rajvardhan Hangargekar, who was part of India's 2022 Under-19 World Cup winning campaign, can replace Deepak Chahar in upcoming IPL. Chahar is currently at National Cricket Academy (NCA) recovering from a hamstring injury sustained during India's third T20I against West Indies. Chahar was bought by CSK for ₹14 crore in recent mega auction.

320.title: Researchers develop algorithm to study Sun's coronal mass ejections
320.article_body: A team of Indian solar physicists has developed an algorithm to study the structure and characteristics of coronal mass ejections (CMEs). Named Simple Radial Gradient Filter (SiRGraF), the algorithm separates the background solar corona to reveal time-scale transient structures of the corona. CMEs are massive clouds of particles that are pushed out into space from the Sun's atmosphere.

321.title: Indian Oil Corporation buys 3 mn barrels of Russian Urals oil amid sanctions: Reports
321.article_body: Amid sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine war, Indian Oil Corporation bought 3 million barrels of Russian Urals oil from Geneva-based trader Vitol for May delivery, said sources. Vitol reportedly sold the cargoes at a discount of $20-$25/barrel to dated Brent. IOC didn't see any issue with the purchase as it wasn't dealing with a sanctioned entity, added sources.

322.title: Germany's greenhouse gas emissions rose by nearly 5% in 2021: Govt
322.article_body: German Environment Agency (UBA) said the country's greenhouse gas emissions rose by just under 5% in 2021 as compared to the year before that. The federal agency added emissions were 39% lower than the 1990s. However, the report revealed that the country emitted 762 million tonnes of carbon-dioxide last year which is 33 million tonnes more than in 2020.

323.title: 2 women Naxals killed in encounter with security forces in Dantewada
323.article_body: Two women Naxals were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Dantewada district of Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, Inspector General of Police (Bastar range) Sundarraj Pattilingam said. He added that two 12-bore rifles and a country-made weapon were recovered from the spot. No security personnel was injured in the operation, the officer added.

324.title: Hijab ban challenged in Supreme Court after Karnataka High Court upholds it
324.article_body: A plea was on Tuesday moved in the Supreme Court challenging the Karnataka High Court order that upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions. The High Court on Tuesday ruled that wearing of hijab by Muslim women doesn't constitute an essential practice in Islam and dismissed the petition to strike down the ban imposed by Karnataka government.

325.title: 509 incidents of Naxal violence reported in 2021: Govt to Lok Sabha
325.article_body: A total of 509 incidents of Naxal or Left Wing Extremism (LWE) were reported in the country in 2021, Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai informed the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. He said that such incidents killed 147 civilians and security personnel last year. The incidents were reported in 46 districts of the country, he added.

326.title: We shot with 2,000 people for Ram's introduction in 'RRR': Rajamouli
326.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli revealed they shot with 2,000 people for actor Ram Charan's introduction sequence in the film. "One person fighting against 2,000 people is absolutely crazy," he added. Rajamouli praised stunt choreographer Solomon Raju for the sequence and said there wasn't a single scratch on anyone. "We shot it for 25 days. It was mad fun," Rajamouli said.

327.title: I'm going to say next year: MI's ₹8 crore buy Archer on playing in IPL
327.article_body: Talking about his availability for MI in IPL 2022, pacer Jofra Archer clarified that he'd only be able to join the franchise next year as he continues to recover from his elbow injury. Archer underwent a second operation on his injured right elbow in December 2021. He was bought by MI for ₹8 crore in IPL mega auction last month.

328.title: There was never infidelity: Will Smith on Rebel Wilson's BAFTA comment
328.article_body: Actor Will Smith reacted to Rebel Wilson's comments about his wife Jada Smith's boyfriends saying, "There's never been infidelity in our marriage". Rebel had said at the BAFTA Awards 2022, "His best performance over the past year was being okay with all his wife's boyfriends." Will further said that he and Jada have never surprised one another with anything ever.

329.title: South Korea to provide Ukraine with non-lethal military supplies
329.article_body: South Korea will provide Ukraine with military supplies except for weapon systems amid Russia's invasion, South Korean Defence Ministry spokesman Boo Seung-chan said on Tuesday. The items will include bulletproof helmets, ready-to-eat meals, blankets and other medical supplies, local media has reported. South Korea had earlier approved sending humanitarian aid of $10 million to Ukraine.

330.title: T'gana govt to fund education of 700 students back from Ukraine: CM
330.article_body: CM KCR on Tuesday said in the state Assembly that the Telangana government will bear the cost of education of 740 students, who were studying medicine in Ukraine and returned after Russia invaded its neighbour. "We'll write on this to the Indian Government immediately," he said. KCR added that students went to Ukraine because they couldn't afford education here.

331.title: Script of 'Spencer' was so precise but never particular: Kristen
331.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart, speaking about the script of her film 'Spencer', said, "I was...impressed with how boldly committed the perspective of the script was because it's such a rich...fascinating world." She added, "The script was so precise but never particular...it never tried to answer...questions." Kristen played Princess Diana in the film and earned her first Oscar nomination for her role.

332.title: Russia will be forced to end war in 10 days due to lack of ammo: Ex-US commander
332.article_body: A former commanding general of the US ground forces in Europe said that Russia will be forced to stop its attack on Ukraine in 10 days, due to a lack of ammunition and manpower. "It's kind of a race actually...until Russia culminates (runs out of resources) and, in my assessment...that's in about 10 days," said Lieutenant General Ben Hodges.

333.title: 147 foreigners brought to India during evacuation from Ukraine: Govt
333.article_body: As many as 147 foreign nationals of 18 countries were rescued and brought to India during the evacuation process of Indians from Ukraine, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said. Many Ukrainian nationals that are family members of Indians were also evacuated. Jaishankar said evacuation from Sumy was extremely complex as Indian students faced prospect of being caught in a crossfire.

334.title: Woman who held 'No war' poster on Russian TV news goes missing: Reports
334.article_body: The woman who interrupted a live news bulletin on Russian state TV channel holding a 'No war' poster has reportedly gone missing. Marina Ovsyannikova, whose lawyers are unable to locate her, is an employee at Channel One and was detained by the police after she held a poster that read "Stop the war, don't believe propaganda, they're lying to you."

335.title: Kawasaki unveils rideable robotic goat; video surfaces
335.article_body: Kawasaki debuted a four-legged electric rideable robotic goat at the 2022 International Robot Exhibition (iREX) in Tokyo last week. The four-legged walking robot 'Bex', which can move on smooth as well as rough terrain, can carry up to 100 kilograms of cargo. The company envisions it can be used for transporting construction materials and carrying out remote industrial site inspections.

336.title: Indian startup ORAI Robotics gifts NFTs to all its employees
336.article_body: Bengaluru-headquartered conversational AI platform ORAI Robotics has gifted Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) as rewards to its entire workforce consisting of over 50 employees. Employees can either store, auction or sell the NFTs back to the employer. Founded by Swapnil Jain and Sujit Das Biswas, the platform facilitates conversations with customers over text, voice and messenger apps.

337.title: Concerned for education, law and order: Shivakumar on Hijab issue
337.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has said, "My greatest concern in this hijab controversy is education and law and order." After the Karnataka High Court gave its verdict to upheld the ban on wearing hijab in educational institutions, Shivakumar tweeted, "HC has given a judgement but responsibility for education law and order and communal harmony lies with the state government."

338.title: UP man arrested for posting morphed image of Adityanath & Mayawati
338.article_body: A 24-year-old resident of Jewar, identified as Amir Khan, was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly posting a morphed picture of UP CM Yogi Adityanath and former CM Mayawati on social media. The complaint was filed by a police officer, who took note after the issue was highlighted on Twitter. Khan didn't tell why he uploaded the picture, said police.

339.title: Journalists barred from entering Ukraine's Irpin after US journalist shot dead
339.article_body: The mayor of Ukraine's Irpin, Oleksandr Markushyn, barred journalists from entering the city citing security concerns. "I very much ask all media representatives as well as Ukrainians [that] do not post photos of our servicemen, their equipment or anything that would indicate their location," said Markushyn. This comes after a US journalist was killed in the town.

340.title: 6,000 Aapda Mitras under training to help during disasters: Govt
340.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said that 6,000 community volunteers are being trained under the 'Aapda Mitra' scheme to provide immediate help during natural disasters. The training is being conducted in 30 districts in 25 states and Union Territories in the country, he added. The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) is implementing the scheme.

341.title: Heat wave warning issued for several states over 4 days, list released
341.article_body: IMD has issued heat wave warning for parts of west Rajasthan from March 15 to 18, over Konkan and Saurashtra-Kutch on March 15 and 16 and over isolated pockets over Gujarat and West Madhya Pradesh from March 15 to 17. It issued similar warning for east Rajasthan for March 16 and 17 and over Odisha from March 16 to 18.

342.title: Messi is an alien without emotions, Ronaldo a human with a soul: Di Canio
342.article_body: Former West Ham player Paolo Di Canio said Lionel Messi is an "alien without emotions" adding that he prefers Cristiano Ronaldo who is a "human with a soul", in comparison to Messi. Messi and Neymar were booed by their own fans throughout PSG's Ligue 1 game against Bordeaux. "Messi's behaviour was not the right one," added Di Canio.

343.title: Ratan Tata-backed BlueStone raises $30 mn, valuation hits $410 mn
343.article_body: Ratan Tata-backed jewellery retailer BlueStone said it has raised over $30 million in funding at a valuation of $410 million. The funding round was led by Sunil Kant Munjal, Chairman, Hero Enterprise. BlueStone Founder Gaurav Singh Kushwaha has confirmed the startup's plans for an initial public offering (IPO), with an aim to raise ₹1,500 crore.

344.title: Women constitute 10.3% of police force in India: Govt in Lok Sabha
344.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Tuesday informed the Lok Sabha that women police personnel constitute about 10.3% of the police force in the country. The minister informed that as per data from Bureau of Police Research and Development, Bihar has the highest number of female police personnel (25.30%), followed by Himachal Pradesh (19.15%) and Chandigarh (18.78%).

345.title: Will make calibrated interventions to keep fuel prices under control: Govt
345.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Tuesday said the government will make "calibrated interventions" to keep domestic fuel prices under control and "safeguard the interests of the common man". He added that retail prices of diesel and petrol have not been revised since November 2021. Fuel VAT has been reduced by many state governments too.

346.title: Eiffel Tower grows 6 metres taller after installation of new digital radio antenna
346.article_body: Paris' Eiffel Tower grew taller by six metres after a new digital radio antenna was attached to its top. Built in the late 19th century by Gustave Eiffel, the tower now measures 330 metres. Apart from being a popular tourist spot, it has been used to broadcast transmissions for more than 100 years.

347.title: We are exploring multiple avenues for 'Baahubali 3': Rajamouli
347.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli in an interview has stated that the makers of 'Baahubali' are exploring different avenues for a sequel. "There are multiple things happening around 'Baahubali'...It will take some time but a few exciting updates...will be out in the due course," the filmmaker added. The two-part film series starred Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty and Tamannaah.

348.title: Aamir's daughter shares pic of actor's b'day cake featuring posters of his films
