348.article_body: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira took to her Instagram Stories on Monday to share a picture of his birthday cake. It featured the posters of Aamir's films like 'PK', 'Lagaan', 'Dil Chahta Hai' and others. The cake was also decorated with a clapboard which had names of his parents, Zeenat and Tahir, written on it. Aamir turned 57 on Monday.

349.title: Rohit Sharma can become a better Test captain than Virat Kohli: Jaffer
349.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma's captaincy, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said the Team India captain can become a better captain in Test cricket than former captain Virat Kohli. "We are seeing the results of how [Team India] have whitewashed each series," added Jaffer. Kohli holds the record for leading Team India to most Test wins as captain.

350.title: Air pollution linked to depressive symptoms in adolescents: Study
350.article_body: A study that examined 213 adolescent participants (aged 9-13 years) has found that exposure to ozone gas, an air pollutant, released by motor vehicles, power plants etc. causes depressive symptoms in adolescents. The study has found that adolescents who lived in areas with more ozone gas levels showed symptoms like persistent feelings of sadness, sleep disturbances and suicidal thoughts.

351.title: Mobile veterinary units to be launched in Madhya Pradesh
351.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday said mobile veterinary units will be formed in the state in order to provide medical assistance to animals. "These units will function on the lines of 108 services," state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. According to the minister, a veterinarian, an assistant and a driver will be deployed in these vans.

352.title: Russia threatened to arrest McDonald's, IBM execs who criticised govt: WSJ
352.article_body: Russian prosecutors issued warnings to McDonald's, IBM and Yum! Brands threatening to arrest corporate leaders for criticising the government, the Wall Street Journal reported. The companies that are withdrawing from Russia amid Ukraine's invasion were also warned that their assets could be seized. Yum! Brands, which operates KFC and Pizza Hut, and McDonald's have suspended operations in Russia.

353.title: Siraj is unlucky to be in an era where India have huge depth: RCB's Hesson
353.article_body: Former New Zealand coach and RCB's Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said, "Mohammed Siraj is really unlucky in terms of [being] in an era where India have a huge amount of depth in the seam-bowling." "Siraj is a great team man and for me that's hugely valuable," added Hesson. Faf du Plessis will lead RCB in IPL 2022.

354.title: Lee Jung Jae wins Best Actor in Drama Series at Critics Choice Awards
354.article_body: 'Squid Game' actor Lee Jung Jae has won the Best Actor award in a Drama Series at Critics Choice Awards held in the US. "I'm grateful to everyone who loves and supports 'Squid Game'," Lee said while accepting the award. Lee became the first Asian actor to be nominated and win the Best Actor at Critics Choice Awards.

355.title: A dream come true: Shabana on working in American series 'Halo'
355.article_body: Shabana Azmi, who'll be seen in the American series 'Halo', said, "Working on this project has been a dream come true." "The show deals in Artificial Intelligence, which is a completely new genre for me, hence it gave me the opportunity to learn," she added. Shabana further said she "thoroughly enjoyed working with Natascha McElhone, Pablo Schreiber and Jen Taylor".

356.title: China shouldn't support Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UK minister
356.article_body: China shouldn't support Russia in its invasion of Ukraine, UK Minister James Cleverly said on Tuesday. "We want to build as broad a coalition of opposition to Russia as possible, so of course, we will have those conversations with the Chinese," Cleverly added. His remarks came amid US officials' claims of Russia requesting military equipment from China.

357.title: Tennis players need to be prepared to deal with hecklers: Nadal
357.article_body: Rafael Nadal said that he feels that players "need to be prepared" to deal with the hecklers. Nadal referred to the incident where female tennis player Naomi Osaka was heckled by a spectator in the middle of her Indian Wells match. "In the real world, that happens...I feel very sorry for what happened to Osaka," Nadal added.

358.title: India need to play Test cricket on better wickets: Parthiv Patel
358.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said India need to play Test cricket on better wickets, following their 2-0 series whitewash in the two-match Test series against Sri Lanka. Patel added that Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne's 107 in the second innings of the Bengaluru Test will send a message to other batters. "If you...apply yourself...you can score runs," stated Patel.

359.title: Invasive insects will kill 1.4 million US street trees by 2050: Study
359.article_body: A recent study has found that invasive insects will kill 1.4 million street trees in the US in next 30 years costing over $900 million to replace. The study predicted that 90% of these tree deaths would be due to emerald ash borer. As per the study, New York, Chicago and Milwaukee would be the hotspots of these tree deaths.

360.title: Prabhas' 24-yr-old fan dies by suicide after 'Radhe Shyam' gets negative reviews: Report
360.article_body: A 24-year-old fan of actor Prabhas died by suicide at his home in Andhra Pradesh, as per a report by ETimes. He reportedly took the step after Prabhas' latest release 'Radhe Shyam' received negative reviews, the report further said. The police reportedly rushed to the spot and an investigation followed.

361.title: RR launch their new jersey, share video featuring stuntman Robbie Maddison
361.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) have launched their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The jersey features horizontal stripes in multiple shades of pink. Further, the collars and sleeves of the jersey are dark blue in colour. RR shared a video on social media featuring Australian stuntman Robbie Maddison 'delivering' the jersey to Sanju Samson, Riyan Parag and Yuzvendra Chahal.

362.title: Mukesh Ambani's grandson Prithvi seen for first 1st time in public, pics surface
362.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani’s grandson, Prithvi Akash Ambani, was on Tuesday spotted for the first time in public with his mother Shloka Ambani at his nursery school in Mumbai. Earlier, while mentioning that they wanted Prithvi to lead a simple life, Ambanis said he will be attending the same nursery school where both his parents went for their schooling.

363.title: Australia, Netherlands start legal action against Russia over 2014 flight crash
363.article_body: Australia and the Netherlands have begun joint legal action against Russia at the UN aviation agency over its alleged role in the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 in 2014. The flight had crashed in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk after being hit by a Russian missile during Crimea's annexation by Russian forces. All 298 passengers and crew on board were killed.

364.title: Tom Cruise's 'Top Gun: Maverick' to screen at Cannes Film Festival
364.article_body: Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick' will be screened at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, according to The Hollywood Reporter. However, the official world premiere of the action film will happen in San Diego a few days before the Cannes screening. The Joseph Kosinski directorial, a follow-up to the 1986 'Top Gun', will have its North American premiere on May 27.

365.title: Proud of the person you're: Shaheen pens note on Alia's 29th b'day
365.article_body: Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish the actress on her 29th birthday. Shaheen posted a picture with Alia and wrote, "I'm so proud of you. Of the person you're evolving into...of the person you work so hard to be." She added, "We call you sunshine because you are dazzling, life-affirming and unfiltered."

366.title: Curfew announced in Ukraine's Kyiv amid Russian shelling
366.article_body: The mayor of Kyiv announced a 35-hour curfew in the city starting at 8 pm local time on Tuesday as the Ukrainian capital was hit by shelling from Russian forces. The authorities said that at least two people were killed in the shelling. Two major blasts were reportedly heard in the city just before dawn.

367.title: Mandhana, Kaur two most dangerous batters: Ellyse Perry on India-Aus match
367.article_body: With Australia set to face India in their next match in the Women's ODI World Cup, Australia's Ellyse Perry has termed Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur as the two most dangerous batters in the tournament. "We are constantly aware of the power in the Indian batting line-up," she added. Currently, Australia are unbeaten in the tournament with four straight wins.

368.title: Jack Ma's Ant sells shares in China tech outlet 36Kr Holdings
368.article_body: Billionaire Jack Ma's Ant has sold its entire stake in China-based tech outlet 36Kr Holdings, a regulatory filing showed. Ant held about 18% of 36Kr Holdings as of early 2021, Bloomberg data revealed. The shares of Alibaba, which owns a third of Ant, fell 10% in New York on Monday, while 36Kr Holdings tumbled 12%.

369.title: 3 inmates including 2 Bangladeshi women escape from Vadodara's reform home
369.article_body: Three women who were sent to Nari Sanrakshan Gruh in Vadodara after being detained by Ahmedabad Police escaped from the reform home in the early hours of Tuesday. Two of these women are Bangladeshi who were caught with fake Aadhaar cards on train at Vadodara railway station. Police had seized fake SIM cards, mobile phones, cash, ATM cards from them.

370.title: 6 held for cheating 200 people in insurance policy scam in Faridabad
370.article_body: Haryana's Faridabad Police arrested six people for allegedly cheating more than 200 people across several states in an insurance policy scam. The accused had been operating from a call centre in Delhi's Janak Puri, police said. "The accused posed as LIC agents and contacted policyholders...made false promises of better returns...extracted money on the pretext of insurance policies," police added.

371.title: NIA files chargesheet against 16 in ₹20,000-crore Mundra Port drug seizure case
371.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed its first chargesheet against 16 alleged narcotics traffickers, including Afghan and Iranian nationals, in connection with the seizure of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port. Nearly 3,000 kg heroin worth around ₹20,000 crore from Afghanistan was seized by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) on September 13.

372.title: Is there anything you can't do: Samantha to Alia on her 29th b'day
372.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Samantha Prabhu wished actress Alia Bhatt on her 29th birthday. Sharing a picture featuring Alia, Samantha wrote, "Happy birthday @aliaabhat...Is there anything you cannot do? Can't wait to celebrate all your achievements....we all know you're just getting started." Earlier also, Samantha lauded Alia's performance in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and called it a "masterpiece".

373.title: I proudly call you my very own Brahmāstra: Karan on Alia's b'day
373.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar on Tuesday took to Twitter to wish actress Alia Bhatt on her 29th birthday, writing, "10 years ago I didn’t know that one day I could proudly call you my very own Brahmāstra." Karan also shared a poster of Alia from upcoming film 'Brahmāstra' and called her the "wind beneath the wings of this labour of love".

374.title: We never knew what it was like to play with the pink ball in India: Rohit
374.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma admitted that pink-ball Tests are challenging, adding that the team is learning to make adjustments having earlier never known what it was like to play with the pink-ball in India. "We have seen Ravindra Jadeja grow as a batter and he seems to get better and better," stated Rohit.

375.title: Zomato, Blinkit sign term-sheet for merger: Reports
375.article_body: Online food delivery firm Zomato and online grocer Blinkit, formerly known as Grofers, have reportedly signed a term-sheet for a merger, reports said. The two companies are likely to approach the Competition Commission of India for an approval soon. Zomato currently owns about 10% stake in Blinkit and may reportedly invest more into the cash-strapped startup until the merger closes.

376.title: Pune Metro sees footfall of over 2.5 lakh commuters since launch
376.article_body: Pune Metro Rail has recorded a footfall of over 2.5 lakh commuters and earned ₹35 lakh in fare revenue since it began services nine days back, officials said on Tuesday. Pune Metro Rail Project was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on March 6 and presently runs on two stretches. The minimum fare has been fixed at ₹10 for both corridors.

377.title: KTR to inaugurate LB Nagar underpass, Bairamalguda flyover in Hyd tomorrow
377.article_body: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao will inaugurate the Bairamalguda flyover and LB Nagar underpass in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The projects are part of the Strategic Road Development Program (SRDP). The 780-metre flyover will ease traffic coming from Owaisi Hospital junction and moving towards Uppal Junction, while the underpass will ease traffic coming from Uppal.

378.title: SC stays Centre's decision to ban telecast of news channel MediaOne
378.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday stayed the Centre's decision banning the telecast of Malayalam news channel MediaOne on security grounds. The channel had challenged Kerala High Court's order upholding the Centre's January 31 directive. "For six weeks, we've been shut down only because it is run by people belonging to a minority community," the channel's lawyer told SC.

379.title: 700 investors face I-T dept's scrutiny for unaccounted crypto transactions: Report
379.article_body: India's I-T department is reportedly planning to issue notices to 700 investors over high-value crypto transactions. "We've a long list of people who were transacting in crypto assets but weren't paying tax...[We've] shortlisted about 700 transactions, where tax liability is very high," an official told The Economic Times. They're likely to face 30% tax, penalty and interest, the report said.

380.title: PM asks BJP leaders to garland Nadda 1st at meeting, video surfaces
380.article_body: PM Narendra Modi at a BJP parliamentary party meeting on Tuesday asked BJP leaders to garland party chief JP Nadda before him. A video shows that BJP leaders got a huge garland for PM Modi after the party's win in recent state elections, but he asked Nadda to come in front. Party leaders also chanted slogans of 'Modi zindabad'.

381.title: Ram Charan was surprised by my acting skills during RRR shoot: Jr NTR
381.article_body: Speaking about working with Ram Charan in 'RRR', Jr NTR said that the former was surprised by his acting skills during the shoot of the film. He added that Charan is a great human being and he feels very lucky to have him as a friend. Jr NTR further said that he's excited for audiences to watch their film 'RRR'.

382.title: Govt staff should not use mobiles for personal use during office hours: Madras HC
382.article_body: Madras High Court on Tuesday said that government servants should not be allowed to use mobile phones for personal use during their office hours. This comes after a health department official filed a petition against a suspension order issued against her for using mobile phone at workplace. The court further directed the state government to frame regulations in this regard.

383.title: 12 inspectors among 14 police personnel transferred in Gurugram
383.article_body: A total of 14 Gurugram police personnel, including 12 inspectors and two sub-inspectors, have been transferred within the district, officials said. "All the transfers were...based on the tenure of posting of an officer, and other administrative factors," a police official said. Notably, this is the first reshuffle after Gurugram Police Commissioner Kala Ramachandran took over the post in February.

384.title: Kim is not a bad person, kids want us to stay together: Kanye West
384.article_body: Rapper Kanye West made a series of posts on Instagram writing that he is not a bad person and neither is his ex-wife Kim Kardashian. He further wrote Kim's reality show 'The Kardashians' needs a new narrative, adding their four children want them to stay together. "I have no celebrity 'friends' that will speak up on my behalf," he added.

385.title: Ali cheated on me; kept calling me even after he got married: Sara
385.article_body: After ex-husband, Ali Merchant's entry in 'Lock Upp', contestant Sara Khan spoke about why they separated months after their wedding on 'Bigg Boss 4'. She said, "I was cheated on a lot of times. I'd forgive...and get back. Then...I...decided to move ahead and get out of it." Sara added that even after getting married again, Ali didn't stop calling her.

386.title: Down in my worst debt, anyone in my place would die by suicide: Kaaranvir
386.article_body: Actor and 'Lock Upp' contestant Kaaranvir Bohra said he is "down in the worst debt" of his life. "Since 2015, whatever work I accept it's to pay off debt...I feel so sorry for myself and for my family, what am I giving them...If someone else was in my position...he would have died by suicide...I'm deep in debt," he added.

387.title: Rajasthan has inked deals worth over ₹10 lakh crore: Industry Min
387.article_body: State Industry Minister Shakuntala Rawat said that the Rajasthan Government has signed over 4,000 MoUs and letters of interest which amounts to ₹10.41 lakh crore of investment in the state. She claimed that this "will generate employment opportunities for 9.40 lakh residents". Rawat added, "For the first time, roadshows were organised in each district to invite investments in the state."

388.title: Everybody has to look alike in schools: Subramanian Swamy on hijab verdict
388.article_body: Senior BJP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy hailed the Karnataka High Court's decision on the hijab controversy. "All that is being asked for is that when you go to school...you have to look like everybody else," Swamy said. "They can't prove if their fundamental rights were breached unreasonably," Swamy added.

389.title: Bentley to roll out one electric car annually for 5 years from 2025
389.article_body: Luxury carmaker Bentley plans to build a new electric car annually for five years from 2025. Bentley, which is targeting to be end-to-end carbon-neutral by 2030, recorded an operating profit of $427 million for 2021, which was $405 million more than in 2020. Bentley's deliveries jumped 31% to 14,659 cars on demand for new hybrid models.

390.title: Govt releases guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination of 12-14 age group
390.article_body: The Centre released guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination of children in the 12-14 age group, which begins from March 16, stating that only the Corbevax vaccine would be administered to them. Two doses of Corbevax would be administered at an interval of 28 days. Vaccination can be availed through online registration (beginning 9 am on March 16) or through onsite walk-in.

391.title: Our batters need to step up in last innings against Australia: Hasan Ali
391.article_body: Pakistan pacer Hasan Ali has said that their batters will "have to take responsibility in the last innings" in order to make a comeback in the second Test against Australia. Pakistan made 148 runs in their first innings which gave Australia a lead of 408 runs. Ali also added that the Australian pacers bowled "quicker" than Pakistan speedsters.

392.title: 7 Indian players including Vihari, Easwaran to feature in DPL 2022
392.article_body: Seven Indian cricketers including Hanuma Vihari and Abhimanyu Easwaran will be participating in the Dhaka Premier League (DPL). Notably, these seven players went unsold at the IPL mega auction and will now feature in the tournament scheduled to start from Tuesday. All ten clubs participating in the DPL are allowed to field one overseas player.

393.title: Suryakumar likely to miss MI's IPL 2022 opener vs DC: Reports
393.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Suryakumar Yadav will reportedly miss his side's IPL 2022 opener against Delhi Capitals on March 27 at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. The 31-year-old is yet to recover from a hairline fracture on his thumb sustained during T20I series against West Indies last month. He was subsequently ruled out of following T20I series against Sri Lanka.

394.title: Nearly 6,000 MSMEs got shut down during FY21 and FY22: Govt
394.article_body: Minister of State for MSMEs Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma on Monday said 5,907 MSMEs got shut down in FY21 and FY22. In FY21, 330 MSMEs got shut down, which increased nearly 17-fold in FY22 to 5,577 MSMEs. Maharashtra topped the chart with 1,608 MSME shutdowns, followed by 527 in Bihar, 521 in Tamil Nadu and 442 in Uttar Pradesh.

395.title: Central Vista Avenue revamp work may end by May: Centre
395.article_body: Union Minister of State, Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore told Rajya Sabha that the Central Vista Avenue revamp work might end by May 2022. The redevelopment of Central Vista Avenue was initially due to be completed by Republic Day. Central Public Works Department (CPWD) is also repairing damage caused during Republic Day parade preparations, officials said.

396.title: EU leaders to travel to Kyiv in show of support for Ukraine
396.article_body: The leaders of Poland, Czech Republic and Slovenia will travel to Kyiv on Tuesday to show support for Ukraine amid Russia's attack. The aim is to express the European Union's unequivocal support for Ukraine and its freedom and independence, said Czech PM Petr Fiala, who will be accompanied by Slovenia PM Janez Jansa and Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki.

397.title: Ashwin loves challenges, he wants to find answer for everything: Irfan Pathan
397.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the off-spinner loves challenges and wants to find an answer for everything. Irfan added, "I feel if Ashwin gets an easy thing, he will want to make it more difficult." He further said, "Ashwin got wickets with difficulties [against Sri Lanka] but he would have got satisfaction from that."

398.title: Shane Watson appointed assistant coach of Delhi Capitals
398.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has been named the new assistant coach of Delhi Capitals (DC) for the upcoming season of IPL. Speaking on his appointment, Watson said, "IPL is the best T20 tournament in the world...I have got incredible memories as a player, and now coaching opportunities...I am really excited."

399.title: Elon Musk's Starlink app becomes most-downloaded in Ukraine: Report
399.article_body: Elon Musk-owned Starlink's app was the most-downloaded app in Ukraine on Monday afternoon after reaching the top spot on Sunday, media reports said. Sensor Tower said the app was downloaded 21,000 times globally Sunday across Apple and Google app stores, of which most downloads came from Ukraine. It has been downloaded nearly 1,00,000 times in Ukraine according to Sensor Tower.

400.title: Dress code should be followed in schools: Hema Malini on hijab ban
400.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Tuesday reacted to the hijab issue and said dress code should be followed in schools and religion shouldn't be dragged in it. She further said that there is no need to impose a new ban on hijab in other institutions or working places. Karnataka HC upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.
